title: Attempt to start a custom FEN fails in Sittuyin
body:
I tried to load up some basic endgames for training against the engine. They were all fairly innocuous positions, and work alright for Makruk and ASEAN. But for some reason, it always says under the board, "The game ended in a draw Because [my username] stalemated" when I choose Sittuyin. 

After a while, I switched to Human vs Human mode. Same result. :(

Steps to reproduce:

1. Using the latest Pychess downloaded from github, please try
Game > New Game > From Custom Position

2.  Choose Sittuyin Chess under Chess Variant and paste this FEN
4k3/8/8/8/8/8/8/4K2R w - - 0 1   (very basic KR vs K endgame)

3. The same FEN works if the variant is changed to Makruk or ASEAN.

title: Wrong engine advice in puzzle
body:
(Split from https://github.com/pychess/pychess/issues/1788)
Sometimes PyChess gives plainly wrong advice, e.g. in Lichess Practice: Greek Gift: Greek Gift Challenge #3, it will insist that BxH7 is "Not the best move" (although it clearly is), and it is only possible to "win" that puzzle by playing a line that doesn't involve the Greek Gift.

title: Can't save PGN of puzzles
body:
To reproduce:
* Open a puzzle, e.g. **Key Squares: Pawn on the 2nd rank**
* Go to **Game** -> **Save Game As ...**
* Click **Save**

What happens:
* The save dialog remains open
* An empty PGN file is created

What was expected:
* The save dialog should close
* The game should be saved as PGN

title: Checkmate being "not the best move" in a puzzle?
body:
Trying out the new puzzles and lessons, and they're amazing! Great work.

Often in those puzzles, when I make a move that achieves checkmate, in the annotation window I am informed that it is **"Not the best move"** and I see a button with the option to **"Retry"**.

I get that perhaps one mate may perhaps *look cooler* than another but surely any checkmate should be considered equally *good*, in terms of winning the game, or am I missing something?

Perhaps the issue is that there was a *quicker* forced mate, but the **"Retry"** button just retracts one move, and so doesn't give you the option of playing out that quicker mate.

Slightly different issue, but also relating to the puzzles: Sometimes PyChess gives plainly wrong advice, e.g. in **Lichess Practice: Greek Gift: Greek Gift Challenge #3**, it will *insist* that `BxH7` is **"Not the best move"** (although it clearly is), and it is only possible to "win" that puzzle by playing a line that *doesn't involve the Greek Gift*.

title: Sittuyin promotion bugs
body:
After the bugfixes in https://github.com/pychess/pychess/commit/c808a4e5de230207322896736914a0801db51a71 there still seem to be two issues with promotions in Sittuyin:
- To my knowledge (implementations in cutechess, Sjaak II, and Fairy-Stockfish; "How to Play Myanmar Traditional Chess" by Maung Maung Lwin), when a player has only one pawn left, the remaining pawn may be promoted from any square of the board and not only on the main diagonals. This rule does not seem to be reflected in PyChess. Example FEN: 6k1/3s4/6PS/5N2/pP6/P7/2S2F2/2K1R3 b - - 0 49
- When a pawn promotes while staying on the same square, a pawn of opposite color is added to the captured pieces (next to the board). E.g., when black promotes b2b2f/b2=F, a white pawn is added to the captured pieces. This does not happen when the pawn promotes with a general move.

title: Chess960 and castling - multiple bugs
body:
Win7 Pro SP2, Pychess 0.99.3 here. I've recently played a (very amateurish) game of Chess960 with Stockfish under PyChess.

[ms vs. Stockfish 9 64.pgn.txt](https://github.com/pychess/pychess/files/2503889/ms.vs.Stockfish.9.64.pgn.txt)

After some time I've realized three problems, probably interconnected:
1. that PyChess didn't allow me to castle (moving the king over to the rook didn't work) - so - just in case - I've saved the ongoing game to a pgn file (attached above)
2. that PyChess crashes when I want to reload the game from the attached file (after 'Load Game', selecting the attached pgn file and clicking 'Open', 'scoutfish_x64.exe' crash occurs)
3. that PyChess refuses to even set up an initial position from this game:  after entering the 'Setup Position' window, copying FEN from the starting position of this game: `rqnknrbb/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RQNKNRBB w FAfa - 0 1` and clicking on 'Paste FEN' the following error message appears: 'Castling availability field is not legal'.

Also:

4. this PGN file (created by PyChess 0.99.3) has mixed line endings (both CRLF and LF are there) but correcting these didn't help.

I've only recently started using PyChess, so maybe I'm missing something, please advise.

title: Engine written in Python not loaded
body:
Hello,

When you add an engine written in Python (like `xboard.py` of SunFish), it is not loaded correctly. My impression is that `vm_command` is not detected and no MD5 is calculated. If you close the window, save and then restart PyChess, the engine is not detected and the GUI is a bit messed up until you remove the added engine from engineDialog.

With NodeJS, there is no issue. The runtime env command is detected. That's why it is strange.

The case is applicable to Windows, not tested under Linux.

Once the error with the MD5 key is solved in `engines.json`, that engine plays well. Loading it is the issue.

Thanks

title: Failed to add feeks engine to PyChess
Failed to add Sunfish engine to PyChess
Preview of the sounds
body:
Hello,

When you set a sound by selecting the sound file, you cannot preview it immediately after with the corresponding button in preference dialog.

I also have the impression that they are effective only when pyChess is restarted.

You can reproduce the issue by clearing the filename in the config file, then set the sound from the GUI.

Also, it would be nice the set the default folder pychess/sounds instead of showing the recent tab of the gtk file dialog. When we add a sound, it cannot be a recent file.

Btw this dialog doesn't offer direct access to a given folder by pasting a path in an edit box. With GIMP, there is no issue, so is it possible to allow that feature in pychess too ?

Thanks

title: Choices not shown in list
body:
Hello,

Let's consider the following PGN :

```
1. e4 e5
2. f4
    (2. Nf3 Nc6
        (2... d6)
    )
 *
```

- Click on `1...e5` : the choices are shown
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24614488/45445476-a3a5c800-b6ca-11e8-8a39-825cbc3a5fdc.png)
- Click on `2.Nf3` : the choices are shown
- Click on `2...d6`
- Click on `2.Nf3` : the choices are **not** shown
- Click on `2...d6`
- Press the left arrow : the choices are shown

It seems that the click is not handled when the previous position is in a subline.

Thanks

title: Pychess-engine doesn't know racing kings latest move draw rule
body: https://lichess.org/62pDE7zR/white#69

title: Side panels in View menu are not checked if pychess is not in ~/.config yet
Analysis not started immediately
body:
Hello

- Turn off the analyzers
- Play a game
- Cancel after few moves
- Analyse the game

When you click on the button to start the analysis, you get something like that due to the activation of the engine :

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/analyzegameDialog.py", line 66, in run_analyze
    analyzer = gamemodel.spectators[HINT]
KeyError: 'hint'
```

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/analyzegameDialog.py", line 74, in run_analyze
    inv_analyzer = gamemodel.spectators[SPY]
KeyError: 'spy'
```

You have then to click again.

HaGN

title: Usage of MultiPV
body:
Hello,

I have a question about MultiPV.

This option is meaningful when the engine is used as an analyzer. But in a match Engine vs Human/Engine, it doesn't make real sense to request alternate lines that will not be processed. It consumes CPU and divides the strength of the engine.

Is it possible to forward the manual value of MultiPV from the options when the engine is used as an analyzer only ?

I have verified with my little engine and it receives a value >1 for MultiPV when it acts as a player (=3 in the options). It should affect the other engines as well.

Thanks for your feedback.

title: Clock start in engine vs engine games
body:
General_Yummy reported on lichess:

"hello there can i ask you a favor! im using py chess GUI and you said i should file a issue on github but im very lazy and dont really know how github works so i guess you are the main developper can you file it for me? when i play or bot vs bot plays the white's clock starts when white made the first move than black's clock starts before they made the 1st move. that way there is a inbalance between white and black because white has +1 move to calculate. it should be changed to start the white time before he made the 1st move or both can think like 20 sec before the 1st move clock starts at move 2 like lichess."

title: Undo causing pychess endless loop
body:
Hi, should this problem be solved in ...99.2? It appears also in my ...99.2 installation. I have made a log again, is this log of interest?  Then I will publish it. So far the error occured when Pychess has to make a decision, where it can loose the game. Also a redraw has been done some draws before. Level 15. Kind regards
![pychessendlessloop180720](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40624880/42986330-69347874-8bf5-11e8-8b0c-25f63d3da70d.png)

title: Lost favorite engines in preferences
body:
Hello

When Stockfish is defined in the list of the engines, it overrides both analyzers at every startup.

When it is not in the list, the normal analyzer overrides the inv_analyzer.

HaGN

title: PyChessBot losing on time on 0+x games on lichess
body:
https://lichess.org/Crapg8NQ/black
https://lichess.org/1weV90NJ

title: pychess probaly endless loop
body:
Sometimes Pychess (on Fedora and Win8.1) seem to remain in an endless loop, when Pychess has problems to win the game. Pychess seem to make endless calculations untill the time (i.e. 40 min) is over and by that I won the game. Level 15.

Can not attach the saved chessplay file it is format pgn, which is not accepted here. (pgn log format of Pychess)

title: Promotion dialog doesn't pops up in interactive lessons if the promotion move is not the latest one in .pgn
Boardview shows initial position when observing FICS game starts
Pychess doesn't load analysis variations from PGN files into analysis panel as moves
body: Pychess doesn't load analysis variations from PGN files into analysis panel as moves, but only as a comment.

title: Undo (Ctrl-Z) deletes all analysis
body: I was using pychess git (from a self-built rpm) to do some analysis, i.e, create a bunch of variations, and I was trying to delete one of the moves from one of the variations, so I hit Ctrl Z, and it deleted all of the variations, which seems to me to be a major bug.

title: Promotion without dialog
body:
Hello,

- Open a PGN file : you may change it to create a study
- If you promote a pawn, you don't have the possibility to choose something else than a queen for the variation line

The preferences don't auto-promote to queen, so the popup window is expectable in that situation.

Regards

title: Win in 1 not found by PyChess Engine
body:
Hello,

Play a suicide game against PyChess Engine from the position `8/8/2n5/8/8/8/5PPP/R7 w - - 0 1`.

Move Ra8, the black knight will not kill itself to win. You can even promote f2.

Regards

title: Latest move in lessons not animated properly
Show the chat box when a lesson is started
body:
Hello,

It is possible that the player has hidden the chat panel.
If he starts a new lesson, he will not see that pychessbot is speaking to him.
The idea is to show the chatbox when a lesson is started.

Regards

title: Broken annotationPanel in endgame
body:
Hello,

For the endgames, it seems that the new alignment in annotationPanel broke the layout of the played moves.

There is no problem for a normal game or a lesson, but here, we only see the last move ?!

Regards

title: Cannot continue game (notation) after I open a stored pgn file.
body:
Hello
I love pychess very much but recently I have some problems with continuing saved games (pgn files). When I open a pgn file and continue to play, pychess does not continue the notation of my draws. I'm very sure that this is not a bug of pychess but a misunderstanding of myself on how to use pychess.
I've attached an example pgn file (renamed to .txt)
Regards, Ralf
[Baier_12 gegen Ralf_12_pychess.pgn.txt](https://github.com/pychess/pychess/files/1756519/Baier_12.gegen.Ralf_12_pychess.pgn.txt)

title: Reactivate the local analysis when an end game is finished
body:
Hello,

- Start a new end game
- Win that endgame in any manner

It is not possible to analyze the played moves at the end because the engine is suspended in the view Learn.

Thanks

title: Valid move rejected in endgame
body:
Hello,

I played around with an endgame "RKP vs RK" (Learn). The promotion to queen (with dialog window) of the pawn is rejected in the following case while it is the best move if you start the same position in another window. Pressing the button «Hint» tells you that you have to promote the pawn. So I suppose that the validation of the move is incomplete in the case of a promotion.

```
[Event "Local Event"]
[Site "Local Site"]
[Date "2018.02.05"]
[Round "1"]
[White "Me"]
[Black "Stockfish"]
[Result "*"]
[SetUp "1"]
[FEN "3K4/4R3/2P5/5k2/8/8/8/6r1 w - - 0 1"]
[PlyCount "8"]
[Termination "normal"]

1. c7 Rd1+ 2. Rd7 Rg1 3. Rf7+ Ke5 4. Re7+ Kd5 {5. c8=Q is the best move but impossible to play : not best move, retry}
```

I give you the PGN because the positions are random, so it cannot be reproduced manually.

Regards

title: Board rotation freezes the display of the evaluations
body:
Hello,

If you rotate the board _manually_ (Ctrl+R) while an analysis is running for the current position, annotationPanel and bookPanel are not refreshed until you change the position.

But if you do a change in annotationPanel that cause it to be fully refreshed (like adding a comment anywhere), you then see that the evaluation was still saved in the background despite the lack of refresh (the shown depth jumps from 11 to 19 immediately for example).

Consequently, it is just an issue with the UI. The analysis process is OK.

Regards

title: Scoutfish fails if the PGN file contains a space in its path
body: The workaround is to put the file in a path without any space.

title: Scoutfish 32 bits on Windows
body:
Hello,

PyChess downloads Scoutfish from Github when you tick the relevant checkbox in the external modules.

**1)** The x32 copy seems to be a 64 bits version, so it doesn't run. The workaround is to recompile `mcostalba/scoutfish` oneself and replace the executable located at `%HOMEPATH%\.local\share\pychess\engines\scoutfish_x32.exe`.

**2)** Scoutfish fails if the PGN file contains a space in its path. The workaround is to put the file in a path without any space.

title: Analyzer started from the wrong position
body:
Hello,

- Disable the analyzers in the preferences
- Consider this game :

```
1. e4 e6 
2. d4 d5
    (2... c6 3. e5 d5 4. f4)
3. e5 *
```

- Select `2... c6`
- Start the analyzer from the preferences

The analyzed position is strange :
- `c5` is shown on the board as `c7c5` but there is no pawn in c7 and we expect a white move to be suggested
- `Bd7` is an impossible move : it becomes possible later in the game so it reinforces the impression that the wrong position is considered here

The issue is visible when the analyzer is started from a variation line, so not from the main line.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24614488/34443931-cb1d4888-ecca-11e7-8f39-e166892e2ee8.png)

Regards,

title: Arrow marks not removed
body:
Hello,

- Play a game
- After some moves, select a previous position
- Draw some green arrows on the board with the right click of your mouse
- Go back to the latest move of the game
- The green arrows are not removed unless you left-click on the board

The arrows should be removed because they are out of their context.

Regards

title: Moving blue rectangle on score panel
Wrong displayed scores
body:
Hello,

Let's consider this game with evaluations and no comment. We can notice that the score has a positive trend all the time :

```
[Event "PyChess"]
[Site "PyChess"]
[Date "2017.12.27"]
[Round "1"]
[Result "1-0"]
[White "Gull 3"]
[Black "Rybka"]

1. c4 {[%eval 0.16/16]} 1... Nc6 {[%eval 0.47/16]} 2. Nf3 {[%eval 0.05/15]}
2... Nf6 {[%eval 0.45/12]} 3. d4 {[%eval 0.23/12]} 3... d5 {[%eval 1.02/12]} 4.
cxd5 {[%eval 0.66/14]} 4... Qxd5 {[%eval 0.60/15]} 5. Nc3 {[%eval 0.63/13]}
5... Qd6 {[%eval 0.96/12]} 6. e4 {[%eval 1.05/12]} 6... Be6 {[%eval 2.83/11]}
7. e5 {[%eval 2.72/11]} 7... Qb4 {[%eval 3.50/11]} 8. a3 {[%eval 2.97/11]} 8...
Qa5 {[%eval 3.54/9]} 9. exf6 {[%eval 3.68/12]} 9... O-O-O {[%eval 3.70/11]} 10.
Be2 {[%eval 3.60/12]} 10... exf6 {[%eval 4.03/12]} 11. O-O {[%eval 3.76/12]}
11... Bd6 {[%eval 5.21/12]} 12. d5 {[%eval 4.33/10]} 12... Bb4 {[%eval
6.41/12]} 13. Qb3 {[%eval 5.46/12]} 13... Bxc3 {[%eval 5.10/12]} 14. dxe6
{[%eval 4.95/12]} 14... Bb4 {[%eval 7.68/12]} 15. exf7 {[%eval 5.28/12]} 15...
Kb8 {[%eval 8.86/11]} 16. axb4 {[%eval 8.58/12]} 16... Qxa1 {[%eval 10.12/15]}
17. Bf4 {[%eval 9.05/12]} 17... Na5 {[%eval 13.39/11]} 18. Bxc7+ {[%eval
15.94/15]} 18... Ka8 {[%eval 16.15/12]} 19. bxa5 {[%eval 16.44/13]} 19... Rd3
{[%eval 26.31/11]} 20. Bxd3 {[%eval 34.59/12]} 20... Qxf1+ {[%eval 327.67/29]}
21. Kxf1 {[%eval 327.67/15]} 21... h5 {[%eval 327.67/12]} 22. a6 {[%eval
327.67/21]} 22... Rb8 {[%eval 327.67/13]} 23. f8=Q {[%eval 327.67/22]} 23...
Rxf8 {[%eval 327.67/23]} 24. axb7# 1-0
```

Without the scores, we have this another PGN file :

```
[Event "PyChess"]
[Site "PyChess"]
[Date "2017.12.27"]
[Round "1"]
[Result "1-0"]
[White "Gull 3"]
[Black "Rybka"]

1. c4 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. d4 d5 4. cxd5 Qxd5 5. Nc3 Qd6 6. e4 Be6 7. e5 Qb4 8.
a3 Qa5 9. exf6 O-O-O 10. Be2 exf6 11. O-O Bd6 12. d5 Bb4 13. Qb3 Bxc3 14. dxe6
Bb4 15. exf7 Kb8 16. axb4 Qxa1 17. Bf4 Na5 18. Bxc7+ Ka8 19. bxa5 Rd3 20. Bxd3
Qxf1+ 21. Kxf1 h5 22. a6 Rb8 23. f8=Q Rxf8 24. axb7# 1-0 
```

So now, open the first PGN file with the evaluations :
- the annotation panel has the correct loaded scores
- the score panel is obviously incorrect because it is alternatively positive and negative **= KO**

Do the same with the second file without the evaluations :
- the annotation panel has indeed no evaluation
- the score panel is evaluated based on the built-in static function **= OK**

Consequently, the issue is that the annotation panel and the score panel must display the same values when the PGN file is loaded.

Regards

title: Negative time in the clock control
body:
Hello,

If you are in the foreground and your time is over, the game is stopped (time forfeiture).

But if you are in another tab (multiple games in parallel) or if pyChess' window is reduced, then the clock may become negative. There is no check for a negative time, so the game never ends.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24614488/33806411-0529c3f6-ddc8-11e7-9abf-488bce394352.png)

It is tested with the latest commit.

Regards,

body:

When the clock is not running (at the beginning or the end of a game), if you move something above it (a menu, a window...), the area is not redrawn in the correct rectangle and it makes a visual glitch like this :

- Window :

Weird but not blocking.

title: Board set back to the initial position
body:
Hello,

- Start a new game
- Define the tabs "Annotation" and "Move history" exactly like this : we see that the move history is blank here

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24614488/33735596-075ee6a4-db90-11e7-8826-994649a558e5.png)

- Switch to the tab "Move history"

The cursor has not followed the moves, so we are set back to the initial position. This effect happens quite often. The workaround is to set the right position back to normal with the navigational buttons in the bottom left corner of pyChess.

title: Paused analyzer restarts after undo
body:
Hello,

- Play a game with the assistance of the analyzer
- After some moves, suspend it with the red button in the bookPanel
- Play some other moves and undo

The engine is restarted but we don't have the red button to pause it. We see the analyzer running because the score in the annotation panel is updated and the green arrow is changing on the board.

It may be required to set a bigger number of seconds to see the effect (ex: 45 seconds of analysis)

Regards

title: Incorrect update for the renamed engines
body:
Hello,

When you add an engine, it takes by default the name of the executable file. If this executable file is physically updated, its MD5 hash will change and pyChess will load the new options correctly. Everything is OK.

Now, rename the engine in the tree view in pyChess. It will cause several problems :
- the engine is duplicated in the tree view (both old and new names)
- the engine is redetected at every launch of pyChess even if it didn't changed
- the options are not refreshed correctly : they remain in the state of the last update, generally when the engine was added for the first time

The workaround is to never change the name of the engine.

Thanks

title: Missing castling information in the generated FEN
body:
Hello,

- Open the setup of the board
- Click on the button "Initial position"
- The generated FEN is `rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq - 0 1`
- Click *again* on the button "Initial position"
- The generated FEN is `rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w - - 0 1`

The castling information are missing in the generated FEN despite the checkboxes are ticked.

Thanks

title: Better handle the click when a variation line is removed
body:
Hello,

Let's consider this very stupid game for the demo. What matters is to have a variation line :

```
[Event "Local"]
[Site "Local"]
[Date "2017.11.14"]
[Round "1"]
[White "Me"]
[Black "You"]
[Result "*"]
[PlyCount "14"]
[Termination "normal"]

1. e4 {Claptrap} d5 {Claptrap} 2. d3 {Claptrap} Nf6 {Claptrap} (2... dxe4)
3. e5 {Claptrap} Nfd7 {Claptrap} 4. e6 {Claptrap} Nf6 {Claptrap}
5. exf7+ {Claptrap} Kxf7 {Claptrap} 6. Qg4 {Claptrap} Bxg4 {Claptrap}
7. f3 {Claptrap} Be6 {Claptrap} *
```

In the annotation panel, we will now remove the added variation with the help of the little black cross.

If you click on it, the variation is removed and the current position is set on the main line. That's OK, **but** it will also depending on the cases :
- display a popup to edit a comment
- select a further position : this is contradictory with the fact that we already moved to the main line

This issue is caused by the fact that the "click up" serves to remove the variation and handle the click as if no variation line was removed. pyChess should not handle the normal click if a variation line was removed just earlier.

Thanks.

Regards

title: Crash when selecting the analyzer
body:
Hello,

**Steps to reproduce**

- Install 2 engines of your choice. For me :
    - Windows: pyChess 0.99, Stockfish 8 (stockfishchess.org) and Komodo 9.0.3 (komodochess.com)
    - Linux: latest pyChess git, Stockfish (official-stockfish/Stockfish) and Stockfish Variants (ddugovic/stockfish)
- Run pyChess
- Define Stockfish as the analyzer for both sides in the options
- Start a new game : human vs. human, normal chess
- Activate the hint and spy arrows from the menu bar
- Play few moves to engage the game
- Menu Action > Resign : the game is finished
- With the widget score, take another position to rewind the elapsed game
- The engines start to analyze the chosen position
- Go to the options and select Komodo as the hint analyzer (change several times if needed)

```

The same error also appears when I close the main window of pyChess while it analyzes a PGN game that I have opened. There is no need here to change the analyzer in the settings to get the crash.

I use these settings :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24614488/31865497-1423b8ae-b770-11e7-9192-3d642e240ea9.png)

Note : the crash only occurs when the analyzer is thinking, not when it has finished ! That's why you must increase the number of seconds of analysis to maximize the probability of the bug.


**Linux**

The application is not dead, but it displays this error message in the console :

```
/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/gi/overrides/GObject.py:536: Warning: /build/glib2.0-EvFudu/glib2.0-2.42.1/./gobject/gsignal.c:2579: instance '0xa044a50' has no handler with id '24528'
  return func(*args, **kwargs)
```

In other words : soft error under Linux, hard error under Windows.

Regards

title: Incorrect detection of an engine
body:
Hello,

I use the latest pyChess and I have installed the package «stockfish» and configured it into pyChess. OK

Now I compile ddugovic/stockfish on Linux in a personnal folder. The output file is «stockfish». I add it to pyChess.

pyChess detects stockfish of the package manager, doesn't add a new entry for my compiled engine, and a corrupted entry `stockfish(1)` is configured unsuccessfully at every run of pyChess.

The workaround is to edit `engines.json` to repair the file (impossible from the UI) or add an engine from a personal folder which is not already named like an existing application in `/usr/bin/*`.

Regards.

title: Bug: last played move of game doesnt always appear
body: Ive noticed that sometimes when getting checkmated the last move doesnt appear on the board (or in the move list) when the game ends and the rematch popup dialog appears. I think this may be another asyncio issue where multiple end-of-game infos are being sent at the same time from  FICS and we dont process them in the proper order so we lose a little bit of information.

title: Stop, start analysis oddity
body:
Jacob Wilkins reported on pychess-people list:

There was one oddity I noticed if I do the following in sequence:

1) Start analysis on a position
2) Stop analysis
3) Make some moves to bring the game to a new position
4) Start analysis again

In that case, I don't seem to get any output from the engine until I stop and start analysis again while keeping that same position on the board (in a couple cases I saw it give analysis, but with incorrect move numbers).

That leads me to suspect that maybe there's something going on with how the "position" command is being sent to the UCI engine; maybe once the hint has been stopped those commands are not sent to keep it current?

title: Skill Level 20
body:
Hello,

There is a specific behaviour for the level 20 when an UCI engine supports the option "Skill Level" from 1 to 20 (like Stockfish). I did a table to explain the different cases :

- Config = the level set in the configuration (engine dialog)
- Game = the selected level to start a new game from the main UI
- Sent = this is the level received by the UCI engine (setoption)

| Config | Game | Sent |
|:------:|:----:|:----:|
| 10     | 10   | 10   |
| 10     | 15   | 15   |
| 10     | 20   | 10   |
| 20     | 10   | 10   |
| 20     | 15   | 15   |
| 20     | 20   | 20   |

The conclusion is that we get the level of the default configuration if we start a new game with the level 20 from the UI. For Stockfish, this issue is transparent because 20 is the default level, but can this be considered as an issue in the general case ?

Thank you.

PS: your website is not reachable for many days now

Hello,

In the dialog to configure the engines, if I select an engine which has at least one option, the list of the options is updated.

title: Pychess sometimes hangs when FICS games are finished
body:
This is kind of hard to reproduce but has occured when sending a flag call, or when checkmating opponent - sometimes pychess hangs and must be forcekilled once a game finishes on FICS.  No errors are logged while this happens. 

The working theory is that gbulb is being flooded by FICS server communication, engine starting, file saving and sending the game over status notification all at the same time.
 
One possible way to fix this was discussed in irc - to introduced forced delays between actions to make life easier for the asyncio event loop - Im not sure if this is the proper fix, but it might be the easiest.

title: enter game notation - feature request & parse error
body:
Would it be possible to relax the rules of PGN when entering a game? For example, allow "oo" or "00" for castling. Currently such notation is silently ignored or results in a non-intuitive error message, depending on the case.

Another example is allow lower case letters for minor/major pieces ("nxe4" for "Nxe4"). Currently the parser produces unexpected output from such input.

Here are examples (see **bold** for unexpected output):

In: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. oo nxe4
Out: **error popup displays "Invalid move. 4.e2e4"**

In: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. o-o nxe4
Out: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. O-O **exe4**

In: 1. e4 e5 2. nf3
Out: 1. e4 e5 2. **f3**

title: Handling of the kings by the board editor
body:
Hello,

**1)** The board editor in pyChess requests a king for both sides. For some variants like suicide chess, this restriction is not applicable.

Example:
5Bnr/6pp/4p3/5p2/8/2N2P2/P1P4P/R3K1NR w - - 0 14

The workaround is to load a special FEN with the button "Paste FEN".

I would like to suggest the removal of this restriction, unless it is made dependent on the variant. Indeed, Stockfish fails if we start from the above position in a classical variant.

**2)** It also not possible to have several kings per side while suicide chess allows it. In that case, there is no workaround because pyChess only keeps one king per side when it pastes the special FEN.

Thanks

title: FICS Password input doesnt handle strings starting with a number
body:
To reproduce : 
--Enter FICS username
--Start typing a password that starts with a number

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/boris/Documents/chess/pychess/lib/pychess/System/uistuff.py", line 184, in callback
    conf.set(key, get_value())
  File "/home/boris/Documents/chess/pychess/lib/pychess/System/conf.py", line 77, in set
    func(None, *args)
  File "/home/boris/Documents/chess/pychess/lib/pychess/System/uistuff.py", line 187, in <lambda>
    conf.notify_add(key, lambda *args: setFromConf())
  File "/home/boris/Documents/chess/pychess/lib/pychess/System/uistuff.py", line 180, in setFromConf
    set_value(v)
TypeError: Must be string, not int

I think we are checking if the input is a integer on every keypress, instead we should check the input after the whole password has been input right before we send info to server.

As a note, should we check for ints at all? As far as I can see with FICS, the only requirement is more than 5 characters for a password. Maybe our requirement is too strict?

title: Clocks going crazy
body:
It happens to me _very_ often that the clocks go completely crazy while playing.
For example, I am playing a game and then my opponent takes a few minutes to make a move [even in easy positions, curious] and meanwhile the clock decreases normally, then he moves and his clock goes negative, then I move and his clock goes back to a higher time than the one it had earlier.

Is this Pychess or FICS? Anyone experienced the same?

See screenshot [but don't look at how stupid I was to draw a won position :'( ]

Curiously enough, this doesn't happen all the time: if I setup a position manually, the table shows up even before a promotion.

title: Co-ordinates
body:
If you use the coord prefrence and flip the board so you  have a blacks perspective, the co-ordinates are upside down.

Might be better to either flip them the correct way up or possible put the co-ordinates along the other 2 edges that are currently blank.

title: Sounds are messed up when moving in a variation
body:
1. Open a game
2. Go back to a move in the middlegame and explore a variation by clicking on the piece you want to move and then on the destination square: no sound is played [should play a move sound?]
3. Explore the variation by dragging a piece from its position to the destination square: the invalid move sound is played [this should not happen].

title: My seeks are no more visible in the Seeks tab
body:
As per title, commit 81399ae974bfbcabe4c5f0027ae3df36b278fbe7 introduced this regression: I can no longer see my seeks in the relative tab, even though they are being posted as someone accepted them.

I also would like to point out that before that commit I could check in the console how many players could see the seek, looking for the relative "(4 player(s) saw the seek.)" message, which is now filtered out but I found useful.

In general, I do like the filter on the console text, but I would not filter this particular piece of information.

title: Load recent game feature not working
body:
I have this weird problem with the feature: I have the "auto save game" option enabled, so that every game of mines gets saved as "/tmp/P1 vs P2.pgn".
Now after I finish a game if I go to "load recent game" I correctly see it in the list [and the path is correct], but if I try to open it it just gives me a blank game, starting position.
If I open the game with "Load game" it works as expected.

title: History of a player
body:
I don't know if this is an issue or a designed function, but if I select the archived tab from the chat window it shows me a list of games I have played recently.

If I then go to the console and type 'history some_other_player' the archive window shows me a list of there recent games.

Is this intentional ?

Update: I guess its a bug since if I then click on examine one of the other players games I get back a message in the console 'There is no history game <gameno> for pgg

title: Console lost ability to wrap text
body: Not sure if this is a regression, but the console window does not wrap text ( anymore?) this  means with the amount of text spew through the console the horizontal scroll bar comes into effect a lot more often but does not set back to char(0) on the next input meaning you are constantly needing to pull the scroll bar back to see current text

title: Player comments echoed to opponent if the player started a conversation with you prior to observing a game the player is in
body:
Strange situation a friend started a chat conversation with me before I started observing his game, after I started observing his game all other private messages between him and myself got echoed to his opponent.

I had to unobserve and restart pychess for this to go away

title: Conversation info not diplaying correctly
body:
The "conversation info" panel in the chat window does not put proper line breaks in the text. As a result, some of the text cannot be read even if the window is maximized.

![screenshot19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12351309/12117555/d720d8fa-b3c1-11e5-8f05-8513ebed36b3.jpeg)

title: Piece Promotion ?
body:
The attached png ( although I had to upload it as a txt file) shows a game I played  recently. If you load this into pychess there seems to be a timing issue at move 29.. c1=Q

The board at this point shows both the prompted pawn -> Queen and also the pawn on c2. It's not until 30. Bxc1 that this pawn disappears. Although there is nothing logically wrong with this I would have thought the pawn would have disappeared the second the Queen appeared ?

( possible bug )

[smoozer (1340) vs. pgg (1286).txt](https://github.com/pychess/pychess/files/76761/smoozer.1340.vs.pgg.1286.txt)

title: Following a game while playing issue
body:
Not sure how we address this but if you are following someone and start a new game yourself, you can run into an issue that the followed player finishes there game and you are still playing and the followed person then starts a new game. At this point the  focus jumps from your game to the person you are following.

This can be very bad if you have very little time on your clock when this event happens

title: Observers are not populated on own games
body: Observer panel is present but the button is missing

title: Opening names not shown in annotation panel header sometimes
body: For example in observed games.

title: Clock times on observed games not displaying correctly sometimes
body:
It was noticed yesterday that if you observe a game in progress, one or both of the clocks can display a negative time. This is then reset to the correct value when a player makes a move, but up to that point you are in the dark about how much time either player may have.

(minor cosmetic bug )

There is an alpha channel on certain pieces of this set that allow the board colour to be visible through the piece.

title: Resizing problem
body:
A friend of mine reports that pychess resizes widgets in an uncomfortable way while going through the moves of a loaded game. See screenshot.
Notice how the window becomes too big for the screen.

She is running the latest dev version; I was not able to reproduce it with the same version, so apparently something system related? Anyway, probably an if carefully placed can workaround this.
![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12351309/11324696/bdf5b90c-9131-11e5-82cb-a2e50e90b48d.png)

title: Cut and Paste
body:
It would be nice to be able to copy / paste web urls etc to either chat channels or console

( enhancement ) unless you can already do this and I just ain't seen it

title: On signing out of  fics, a users presence in chat channels is not removed
body:
When a user leaves fics any channels that she/he was in maintains a ghost of there presence within the chat channel windows

(cosmetic bug)

title: primary variable not being set when a context switch takes place between 2 or more observed games
body:
The primary variable is used to direct whispers to the correct observed board.

If you have 2 or more observations on the go and you do a context switch between boards, the primary variable is not being reset to reflect this context switch hence you end up whispering to the wrong observed channel

( major bug request non critical )

The primary variable can be manually set using primary <board no>

title: IndexError when exploring variations
body:
I was exploring a variation of a game, and I got a long list of these tracebacks

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/gamewidget.py", line 647, in <lambda>
    backbut.connect("clicked", lambda w: board.view.showPrev())
  File "/opt/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardView.py", line 1453, in showPrev
    self.shown -= step
  File "/opt/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardView.py", line 368, in _set_shown
    if not self.model.lowply <= shown <= self.model.variations[self.shownVariationIdx][-1].ply:
IndexError: list index out of range
```

I'll try to recall what I did:
1) select a position in "Annotations" and look at it with the analyser
2) double click variation in "Hints" to add it to "Annotations"
3) go a few moves into this variation, and then decide to move differently to create a sub-variation
4) [maybe, not sure] delete the sub-variation and the variation

Result:
Pieces go missing, I can't navigate the positions anymore and I have to close pychess.

title: Variation breaks up after total number of moves
body:
I noticed that if I insert a variation in a complete game with more moves than the number of total moves in the match, the graphics messes up and I can't insert the variation properly.

Steps to reproduce:
1. start a new game and make a few moves, say 5
2. resign and go back to move 3
3. start a variation longer than the 2 remaining moves

Result: the variation isn't inserted and the graphics glitches.

title: bug : friends notification popdown only displays 2 logged on friends.
body:
When logging onto FICS, if a user has many friends online we currently drop pop-up notifications for the first 2 friends (offering to chat or close). 

Instead we should either :
1) Send a message saying multiple users online and not display them one at a time
2) Display a notification for all friends online so as to not deceive the user that only 2 are online.

title: Taking back messes up the game
body:
Taking back a move messes up the graphics and the game synchronization, i.e. I can't go on playing after that and the pieces don't place properly on the chessboard.
If I try to move again it considers it as a "booked move", just like when I play while the opponent is thinking.

I understand the description is not the clearest piece of literature one could wish for :D

title: PyChess sent illegal move to FICS
body:
![invalid_move_2015-07-12_23-54-09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/479964/8640301/5a7c766e-28f3-11e5-87a6-08742d224fc8.png)
(The screenshot is from a saved and reopened game, not the original one.)

PyChess sent e3-e2 as my next move, and at this point I wasn't able to move. PyChess thought it's my partner turn, and finally I was lost by time.

from log:

title: Board size save/restore is not accurate.
body:
When I start my first FICS game I used to maximize the board window dragging the bottom sizer as much as possible (shrink the hint panel vertical). But after the game finished and closed the game, the next game board window opens is a little bit smaller again. 
![boardsize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/479964/7809196/ec805bc8-0398-11e5-9198-6731707ee5e3.png)

title: GLib Bug
body:
Bajusz Tamas' last patch allowed me to add Spike, but not into the list. Spike does not appear in the Engines List when added, and the following error is obtained;

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pychess/System/SubProcess.py", line 133, in __io_cb
    line = channel.next()#readline()
glib.GError: Invalid byte sequence in conversion input

title: Pieces disappear
body:
![screenshot - 04062015 - 11 47 56 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10868693/7001482/ee3ea19e-dc52-11e4-80aa-75f47b6ec8cb.png)

Upon moving my cursor over a piece, it disappears. This problem is represented as;

  File "/home/agd/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardView.py", line 984, in drawSpecial
    context.set_source_rgba(*color)
TypeError: set_source_rgba() argument after \* must be a sequence, not RGBA

I am up-to-date with the dependencies.

title: Panels are broken
body:
![screenshot - 04022015 - 02 37 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10868693/6961598/fabe8a8e-d945-11e4-8c9a-68bcbbcdff6b.png)

Hint panel, comment panel..etc are misplaced.

This anomaly is represented by the errors in the log as;

title: PyChess misinterprets sacrifices
body:
Original [issue 936](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=936) reported by [xatrickforge](https://code.google.com/u/107950337048345824018/) 2015-01-14

The comments section is very important for beginners, who view it much during their games and I feel much attention should be laid on this. PyChess sometimes, misinterprets a sacrifice.

For example;

1.c4 Nf6 2.Nf3 g6 3.g3 Bg7 4.Bg2 O-O 5.d4 d6 6.Nc3 Nbd7 7.O-O
e5 8.e4 c6 9.h3 Qb6 10.d5 cxd5 11.cxd5 Nc5 12.Ne1 Bd7 13.Nd3
Nxd3 14.Qxd3 Rfc8 15.Rb1 Nh5 16.Be3 Qb4 17.Qe2 Rc4 18.Rfc1
Rac8 19.Kh2 f5 20.exf5 Bxf5 21.Ra1 Nf4 

21...Nf4 was a sacrifice but PyChess just says "black moves knight to f4"

Another example:

In this position; r3rk2/pb2bpp1/1n5p/q1pP1B2/1p3B2/5N2/PPQ2PPP/R2R2K1 w 

After making the move Bc8 (which is a sacrifice), PyChess still doesn't call it a sacrifice and says "white moved bishop to c8" - It should say "White sacrifices material" rather than that.

please fix this.

title: System freeze during FICS game
body:
Original [issue 931](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=931) reported by [yoanntar](https://code.google.com/u/yoanntar/) 2014-12-01

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Playing a game on FICS
2. waiting opponent moves
3. clocks freeze

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The system totally freeze, impossible to open a terminal to leave or shut down computer. Hard manual computer shutdown to issue.

**Does it happen every time?**
Already some freeze in the same configuration but first time complete system freeze.

**What version of the product are you using?**
pychess beta anderssen 0.12 rc3

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
.deb

**Please provide any additional information below.**
My system is Xubuntu 14.04LTS. When i used pychess on the 12.04LTS version pychess never crashed or frozed the system, it was very stable.

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"
Done. Tell me if you want the log file after reconnection to FICS after computer restart.

Thank you very much for help and thank you for this very good freeware.

title: CRITICAL  Gstreamer-Bug Freezing App Possibly
body:
Original [issue 920](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=920) reported by [tobimensch](https://code.google.com/u/113011529744465311205/) 2014-10-10

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. using pychess from mercurial
2. on latest fedora 20 with all updates 
**3.**

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

The app freezes and must be killed.

Btw. I don't know if the freezing has something to do with the error
(which is CRITICAL according to the message), could be unrelated,
who knows. But I saw this error a couple of times. Should be fixed either way.

**Does it happen every time?**
yes, when I run it long enough

**What version of the product are you using?**
latest mercurial sources from a few weeks ago

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
mercurial

**Please provide any additional information below.**

(pychess:24373): GStreamer-CRITICAL **: 
Trying to dispose element test, but it is in READY instead of the NULL state.
You need to explicitly set elements to the NULL state before
dropping the final reference, to allow them to clean up.
This problem may also be caused by a refcounting bug in the
application or some element.

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

title: Crash on startup because of missing gtk.gdk.threads_enter()
body:
Original [issue 919](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=919) reported by [rverschelde](https://code.google.com/u/rverschelde/) 2014-09-28

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start pychess as packaged on Mageia (pristine 0.12rc2 with a patch for the location of gtksourceview2)
2. It crashes with the following output:

$ pychess 
*\* Message: pygobject_register_sinkfunc is deprecated (GstObject)

(pychess:16371): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: g_object_set_qdata: assertion 'G_IS_OBJECT (object)' failed
Attempt to unlock mutex that was not locked
Abandon

A fellow Mageia contributor is writing a patch to fix this, I'll post it here as soon as it's ready. It seems to be missing a call to missing gtk.gdk.threads_enter() (and missing gtk.gdk.threads_leave()), though those seem to be deprecated: https://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-Threads.html#gdk-threads-init

**Did you use PyChess from a repo, tarball, install or hg?**
Packaged version of PyChess 0.12rc2 for Mageia Cauldron. The spec file can be seen here: http://svnweb.mageia.org/packages/cauldron/pychess/current/SPECS/pychess.spec?view=markup&pathrev=728000

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile from ~/.local/share/pychess/**
http://paste.fedoraproject.org/137133/11908143

title: "Undescribed panel" in Sidepanels of Preferences dialog
body:
Original [issue 901](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=901) reported by [DavidLakata](https://code.google.com/u/114867860268151591108/) 2014-08-06

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Open the Preferences dialog from the Edit menu.
2. Open the Sidepanels tab.
3. Click on a panel from the list, and select the About button.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
When you click on the Sidepanels tab, a new board is opened. When you switch to another tab in the Preferences dialog, the new board goes away. Clicking on the Sidepanels tab doesn't seem to imply that a new board will be opened.

Also, with the exception of the "Hints" panel, when you click on the About button for a particular panel, a new dialog opens with "Undescribed panel". The descriptions of the panels already describe the panels well, so most of the panels probably do not need an About dialog. Perhaps the About button should be disabled for panels that do not require additional description.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes.

**What version of the product are you using?**
0.12rc1

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
I'm using the svn version, although the problem is also present in 0.12beta3, which is installed in my Ubuntu 14.04 desktop.

title: unable to add new engines after removing engines.json
body:
Original [issue 900](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=900) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-07-19

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. rm ~/.config/pychess/engines.json (so you only have PyChess.py in Engines dialog)
2. Download latest stockfish binary from http://abrok.eu/stockfish/ to /usr/local/bin
3. Try to add the new stockfish binary as an engine to Engines dialog via the New button

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Instead of a new engine profile being created in the Engines dialog, the existing profile for PyChess.py has its "Command:" value overwritten/set to /usr/local/bin/stockfish-whatever

title: holding pieces in crazyhouse games not always showing up
body:
Original [issue 894](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=894) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-25

I was playing a crazyhouse game on FICS and after 30. P@g7, the 2 pawns I had weren't showing up in my list of holding pieces.

title: PyChess does not start
body:
Original [issue 892](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=892) reported by [brentdewe](https://code.google.com/u/106716189158266629480/) 2014-06-22

I downloaded the source from the source browser, and tried to run it.
It shows the following:
ERROR: Could not import modules.
Please try to run pychess as stated in the INSTALL file

This also occurs when I use the latest source from the download page.

First installing with setup.py does not solve it, but adding the lib directory to $PYTHONPATH before running does.

Looking at lines 50-52 in pychess:

if os.path.isdir(os.path.join(this_dir, ".hg")) and \
        os.path.join(this_dir, "lib") not in sys.path:
    sys.path = [os.path.join(this_dir, "lib")] + sys.path

No ".hg" dir exists and so the "lib" directory is not added to the path.

title: IndexError when observing FICS game
body:
Original [issue 891](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=891) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-20

I was observing a FICS game and got this:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardControl.py", line 272, in motion_notify
    return self.currentState.motion(event.x, event.y)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardControl.py", line 394, in motion
    if cord and self.isSelectable(cord):
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardControl.py", line 440, in isSelectable
    if self.getBoard()[cord] == None:
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardControl.py", line 336, in getBoard
    return self.view.model.getBoardAtPly(self.view.shown, self.view.shownVariationIdx)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/Utils/GameModel.py", line 322, in getBoardAtPly
    return self.variations[variation][self._plyToIndex(ply)]
IndexError: list index out of range

except statements without an exception name/type in them is a big python no-no.

title: Pychess freeze while playing on FICS
body:
Original [issue 888](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=888) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2014-06-16

Played a rated blitz game with Meddyxx, then pychess freeze.

After logging in again, I show that the game hase been adjourned, koz I lost the connection to the server, and Meddyxx requested adjournment.

title: FICS freeze
body:
Original [issue 887](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=887) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-14

I got this FICS freeze, so apparently these freezes aren't fixed with the finger grained glock usage, they're just harder to reproduce now. title: hint arrow drawing during piece move animation makes animation choppy and slow
body:
Original [issue 884](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=884) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-12

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Observe a game or play a local game with full animation on and a hint analyzer engine running

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The move animations are often slow and choppy (especially with fullscreen or a large board) when hint arrows are drawn quickly because the hint arrows are being drawn at the same time that the move animation drawing is occuring.

An obvious solution would be to queue hint arrow drawing actions until the move animation finishes.

title: gamemodel never starts (GameModel.run() isn't entered) sometimes
body:
Original [issue 883](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=883) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-11

I was doing some testing on FICS by following a player who was playing lots of lightning matches and after about 4 different game tabs with respective analyzer instances (stockfish) had been opened (creating alot of CPU overhead and apparently altering timings enough to manifest this bug), and upon the player starting a new match, the gamewidget was created and attached and the board was drawn, but the pieces weren't drawn and the game didn't start.

I think this is caused by a race condition present in ThreadPool.py. My reasoning is based on the attached log, in which ionest.workfunc finishes according to the log, and therefore, GameModel.loadAndStart must have completed and GameModel.start() must have been called. Also, the next thread dump after the game is unsuccessfully started shows this thread which doesn't show up previously:

Thread: ICGameModel.run:537 (140291273123584)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 784, in __bootstrap
    self.__bootstrap_inner()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 811, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/System/ThreadPool.py", line 103, in run
    self.wcond.wait()    # wait for work
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 339, in wait
    waiter.acquire()

So it appears that GameModel.run is called and the thread is initialized (via 'a.func = ...') and named in ThreadPool.start, yet the following first line of GameModel.run is never executed:
        log.debug("GameModel.run: Starting. self=%s" % self)

The only explanation I can think of is a race condition where, after the ThreadPool.Worker finishes running its self.func and puts itself back into the thread pool via:

```
                    self.worker = None
                    self.queue.put(self)
```

... the code in ThreadPool.start below:

```
    a.worker = lambda: worker(*args, **kw)
    a.name = worker.name

    a.wcond.acquire()
    a.wcond.notify()
    a.wcond.release()
```

... runs before the code in ThreadPool.Worker.run below does:

```
                self.wcond.acquire()
                self.wcond.wait()    # wait for work
                self.wcond.release()
```

... Which would cause the Worker to sit endlessly waiting for a wcond.notify that never will occur.

title: python interpreter crash when using FICS
body:
Original [issue 880](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=880) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-01

As with issue #878, at the time of the crash I was running with a patch to make glock usage in FICS callbacks more fine grained, so this might be specific to that patch rather than a problem with hg tip. I doubt it is specific to that patch though, because I've seen these types of crashes before.

title: in ongoing games moves in annotation panel get light black color
body:
Original [issue 879](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=879) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-01

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Observe a game on FICS

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The moves should have dark black color but they're light black instead. After the game ends, they're the correct dark black again.

title: python interpreter crash in Helper connection
body:
Original [issue 878](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=878) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-06-01

I was following a player and had about 7 open tabs from the player's previous games when I got this crash. I'm in the process of trying to get abrt-server (Fedora 19) to not auto-delete crash directories which contain other useful debugging info like cores. So hopefully in the future I'll be able to get more info when it happens. At the time I was running with a patch to make glock usage in FICS callbacks more fine grained, so this might be specific to that patch rather than a problem with hg tip.

The code it was executing at the time of the crash doesn't do any writes
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/ic/FICSObjects.py", line 416 in __contains__

which is in pychess.ic.FICSObjects.FICSPlayers.__contains__:
        if hash(player) in self.players:

... so maybe player or self.players got set to a bad memory value somehow?

Fatal Python error: Segmentation fault

title: CECPEngine.py doesn't clean up Timer() objects leading to orphaned threads
body:
Original [issue 877](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=877) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-05-30

title: big red X appears only when clicking squares in FICS gamewidget after killling connection
body:
Original [issue 872](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=872) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-05-26

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Play or observe a FICS game
2. Close the FICS Lounge window

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The gamewidget is supposed to have that big red X drawn, but it's not drawn immediately or at all. For me, it's like the game minesweeper :) The lines of the X only start to appear/get drawn near adjacent board squares as i click them.

Maybe this is a regression related to my fixes recently? Either a) clear dragged premove pieces after game end and/or b) my recent BoardControl deadlock fixes

title: difficulty pasting FEN positions into Enter Game Notation dialog
body:
Original [issue 871](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=871) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-05-16

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Try to paste a FEN position for which you don't know what the last two FEN fields (5: halfmove clock, and 6: fullmove number) for the game are, into the Enter Game Notation dialog. In my case, first, I tried pasting "2rq1rk1/pp2ppbp/1n4p1/3pP3/2P5/1P2B3/P2NQPPP/2R2RK1 b - - - -" which led to a "Parsing error" and the attached screenshot. Then I tried "2rq1rk1/pp2ppbp/1n4p1/3pP3/2P5/1P2B3/P2NQPPP/2R2RK1 b - - -" which also led to the screenshot attached. It wasn't until I put in "2rq1rk1/pp2ppbp/1n4p1/3pP3/2P5/1P2B3/P2NQPPP/2R2RK1 b - -" that the position finally loaded.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
I think pychess should correct minor errors in the FEN (possibly with an infobar message that has a close button explaining the corrections/errors/adjustments made) and start the game. The parsing error in the screenshot doesn't explain what the real problem is either.

title: Undo fails if opponent has not moved
body:
Original [issue 855](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=855) reported by [JamesSEdgar](https://code.google.com/u/115065471935005463948/) 2014-04-20

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1.Make a move.
2.Undo before opponent moves.
3.Only your move is removed, but it remains other players move.  If the other player is the computer, it will not actually move.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Only mistaken move is undone.  Turn reverts to player who asks for undo.

Mistaken move is removed, but turn remains with opponent.  PC opponent never makes another move.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
0.10.1

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
Fedora 20 from repo

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**

3. Double-click an analysis line in Hint panel to insert it in Annotation panel

title: new moves in observed games step game forward one when examining variation position
body:
Original [issue 845](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=845) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-03-07

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Observe a game on FICS and double-click an analysis line in Hints panel to add the variation to Annotation panel
2. Click on a move in variation in Annotation panel to examine that position
3. Wait until a new move is played in the game

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The board should stay on the position you're looking at. Instead, when a new move is played, the position is moved forward one as if you'd clicked on the "Step forward one move" button in the game widget.

I was observing a FICS game and I arrowed back a few moves to examine a certain position then went back to the end of the game (i think) and double-clicked a variation in the Hint panel to insert it into the annotation panel.

title: Pychess freezes after my partner forfeited on disconnection
body:
Original [issue 838](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=838) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2014-02-16
1. Played a lightning game on FICS with TotoLeTak
2. Game ended with forfeit on disconnection
3. Stockfish hint analyzer started
4. Pychess freeze

title: using Sjeng for crazyhouse analysis doesn't work
body:
Original [issue 837](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=837) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-02-14

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load the attached PGN file into pychess as a crazyhouse game with Sjeng as your Hint analyzer

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
PyChess doesn't show any hint analysis.

title: deadlock when changing Hint analyzer
body:
Original [issue 836](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=836) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-02-14

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. start pychess with a fresh config (not sure this step is necessary)
2. change Preferences->Hint analyzer from pychess to something else  
3. if step 2 didn't trigger it, keep changing the Hint analyzer until it's triggered

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

title: PyChess freezes after my partner aborted a FICS game before move 1.
body:
Original [issue 834](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=834) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2014-02-04

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Accepted an unrated blitz seek
2. My partner aborted the game before any move was taken
3. freeze

title: pychess crash upon loading FEN
body:
Original [issue 830](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=830) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-01-22

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load the attached FEN file with, File -> Open Game

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/System/glock.py", line 89, in handler
    function(emitter, *extra)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/sidepanel/annotationPanel.py", line 551, in update
    self.insert_nodes(self.gamemodel.boards[0].board, result=result)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/sidepanel/annotationPanel.py", line 347, in insert_nodes
    shown_board = self.gamemodel.getBoardAtPly(self.boardview.shown, self.boardview.shownVariationIdx)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/Utils/GameModel.py", line 296, in getBoardAtPly
    return self.variations[variation][self._plyToIndex(ply)]
IndexError: list index out of range

title: Invalid FEN strings shouldn't crash pychess
body:
Original [issue 829](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=829) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2014-01-22

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load an invalid FEN string. For example, a file with just "8/q6k/q6p/pR3Np1/P3P3/6P1/1Q3P1P/6K1" in it.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
pychess should probably display a warning dialog giving an error message. Instead it crashes:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardPreview.py", line 123, in on_selection_changed
    self.chessfile.loadToModel(sel, -1, self.gamemodel)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/Savers/fen.py", line 32, in loadToModel
    model.boards = [model.variant.board(setup=fen)]
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/Utils/Board.py", line 41, in __init__
    self.board.applyFen(setup)
  File "/home/gatto/code/hg/pychess/lib/pychess/Utils/lutils/LBoard.py", line 139, in applyFen
    len(fenstr)
SyntaxError: Needs at least 6 fields in fenstr. Pos(36)

title: can't install on pychess-0.12beta4 on Fedora 19
body:

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. [gatto@fedora-19 pychess]$ sudo yum install pychess-0.12beta4-1.noarch.rpm

title: Threat Analysis by Stockfish doesn't work
body:
Original [issue 824](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=824) reported by [fabrizio.ch.tablet](https://code.google.com/u/117100794831679601162/) 2013-11-27

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. When I click on "x" button (threat analysis), no lines are shown..

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The expected would be seeing threat lines; I cannot see anything...

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes.

**What version of the product are you using?**
Stockfish 4 64 SSE 4.2

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
On a chess program..

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

title: Pychess freezes on Ubuntu with Unity
body:
Original [issue 822](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=822) reported by [me@nyuviu.net](https://code.google.com/u/107944788206661924239/) 2013-11-10

Hi!

First: I love pychess because I like the design and the playful but functional style. But I encounter some problems since update to Beta.
Pychess freezes and crasdhes regularly on various occasions,since I upgraded from the stable version to the Pychess 0.12beta4-1. I use it on Ubuntu 13.10.

 Playing ffline and playing online on FICS freezes Pychess, if:
'Giving up' freezes pychess.
'Saving' freezes pychess.
'Enable undo'freezes pychess.
'Offer Remis' freezes Pychess
'Break' freezes Pychess
Pychess crashes frequently after starting FICS; many times in between a game or while doing a move.

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. 'enable undo'
2. 'give up'
3. 'Save' or 'save to file'
4. Opponent 'Give up'
5. Crash unpredictable.
6. Ask for a 'Break'
7. Offer 'Remis' (Literally all functions of the actions segment)

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

I would expect that pychess is doing what it is told instead of a freeze. I have to force quit and close instead.

**Does it happen every time?**

Freeze yes. Crash frequently.

**What version of the product are you using?**

Pychess 0.12beta4-1

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

I used the recent deb and updated the archive as described in another post to make sure I got all the bugfixes.

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

title: Fatal IO error 11
body:
Original [issue 821](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=821) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2013-10-25

Played some game on FICS. After my partner (lohem) resigned, I got:

tamas@tami:~$ LANG=C p

*\* (process:7877): WARNING **: Trying to register gtype 'GMountMountFlags' as enum when in fact it is of type 'GFlags'

*\* (process:7877): WARNING **: Trying to register gtype 'GDriveStartFlags' as enum when in fact it is of type 'GFlags'

*\* (process:7877): WARNING *_: Trying to register gtype 'GSocketMsgFlags' as enum when in fact it is of type 'GFlags'
*_ Message: pygobject_register_sinkfunc is deprecated (GstObject)
pychess: Fatal IO error 11 (Resource temporarily unavailable) on X server :0.0.

The tail of log:
14:44:10 ('Ping', '14:10:6.839') Debug: 64 bytes from fics.freechess.org (69.36.243.188): icmp_seq=4 ttl=51 time=211 ms
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'raw') Debug: 
lohem is no longer available for matches.
fics% 
<wd> lohem
fics% 
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'nonmatched') Debug: 
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'lines') Debug: lohem is no longer available for matches.
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'on_player_unavailable') Debug: lohem is no longer available for matches.
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'lines') Debug: 
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'nonmatched') Debug: 
14:44:10 ('GuestVHGG', 'lines') Debug: <wd> lohem

title: PyChess freezes in save game dialog
body:
Original [issue 819](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=819) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2013-10-05

Played some FICS game with a partner (viralpune). All finished ok. Then we didn't want to play another one, so NO rematch offer. Then I wanted to close my game tabs, clicked on close (x), and the save dialog appeared, but PyChess freezes. The tail of log:

10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'raw') Debug: 
viralpune is no longer available for matches.
fics% 
<wd> viralpune
fics% 
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'nonmatched') Debug: 
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'lines') Debug: viralpune is no longer available for matches.
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'on_player_unavailable') Debug: viralpune is no longer available for matches.
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'lines') Debug: 
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'nonmatched') Debug: 
10:56:25 ('GuestNFYQ', 'lines') Debug: <wd> viralpune
10:56:25 ('gbtami', 'raw') Debug: 
<s> 127 w=apollolune ti=00 rt=1636  t=3 i=0 r=r tp=blitz c=? rr=0-9999 a=f f=f
fics% 
apollolune (1636) seeking 3 0 rated blitz m ("play 127" to respond)
fics% 
10:56:25 ('gbtami', 'nonmatched') Debug: 
10:56:25 ('gbtami', 'lines') Debug: <s> 127 w=apollolune ti=00 rt=1636  t=3 i=0 r=r tp=blitz c=? rr=0-9999 a=f f=f
10:56:25 ('gbtami', 'on_seek_add') Debug: <s> 127 w=apollolune ti=00 rt=1636  t=3 i=0 r=r tp=blitz c=? rr=0-9999 a=f f=f
11:02:58 ('GuestNFYQ', 'raw') Info: 16 date
11:02:59 ('gbtami', 'raw') Info: 404 date

title: Pychess freezes after accepting FICS rematch offer
body:
Original [issue 818](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=818) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2013-09-21

I played 2 blitz match with my partner, then he offered the third one. After clicking on Accept button PyChess freezes. The tail of log is:

title: UCI position command usage regression
body:
Original [issue 813](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=813) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2013-09-08

<MrJones> btami: btw, PyChess has a notable issue with UCI too
<MrJones> it sets the position for UCI chess engines through FEN directly
<btami> MrJones: I feel this was my latest commits :(
<MrJones> that is not good, because then the engines are not aware of all moves that happened (that is important for engines that take care of threefold repetition and might even want to use it actively to end games in a draw)
<MrJones> a more useful and helpful way to set the position is through: position startpos <full history of moves in coordinate algebraic notation>

title: Engine score graph while playing violates FICS rules
body:
Original [issue 809](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=809) reported by [wmahan](https://code.google.com/u/116700931876216774263/) 2013-08-22

> What steps will reproduce the problem?
> 1.Install PyChess
> 2.Start a game
> 3.Click the "score" tab
> 
> What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
> Actual: An engine graph is shown, which could assist the player in evaluating the position.
> Expected: No engine results should be shown, because "help abuse" on FICS clearly states that using an engine while playing is abuse:

"Assistance includes (provided by any means) move/plan suggestion,
position/move/plan evaluation and list of legal and illegal moves as well
as list of pieces protected or unprotected. In short, it includes any
information that can be used to make a move or set of moves during a game.
If you are using an interface that provides any information listed above,
you must disable it while playing on the server."

> Does it happen every time?
> Yes
> 
> What version of the product are you using?
> 0.12beta3
> 
> Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
> tarball/svn?
> I installed pychess_0.12beta3-1_all.deb.
> 
> Please provide any additional information below.
> Thanks for your work on Pychess.

1. Join a tournament and disconnect during a tournament game

13:59:08 ('mgatto', 'lines') Debug: mamer(TD) tells you: You play white against romeosgr in this round of tourney

I'm guessing it's a deadlock resulting from the Chat window init process getting acquiring a lock and blocking other stuff.

title: delaying getting player and games lists delays player notifications
body:
Original [issue 805](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=805) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2013-08-04

I don't think that asking for the player lists and game lists should be delayed until the user clicks the respective tabs. This causes notifications that depend on players being detected online like "Joe who you have an adjourned game with is online" to be delayed unnecessarily or not be shown at all. They should only be delayed for a few seconds or not delayed at all.

the <wa ...> availability notices in HelperConnection only work for when a player connects and i think when a player manually makes himself available/unavailable/etc.

i tried messing around with pin/gin/availinfo for HelperConnection in FICSConnection._connect() but I still couldn't get it to output these types of messages after the respective players in a game has their game end:
## 09:12:01

khakimenez Blitz (1196), Std (1424), Wild (----), Light(----), Bug(----)
is now available for matches.
BocaJuniors(U) Blitz (++++), Std (++++), Wild (++++), Light(++++), Bug(++++)
is now available for matches.
09:12:11

For some reason I don't yet understand, I could only get them to appear as in the attached patch which parses the messages from the normal (non-helper) connection.

title: Engines list "Command" field is sometimes not retained properly
body:
Original [issue 779](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=779) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2013-06-30

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. (optional) Remove ~/.config/pychess for clean config
2. Open pychess's Edit > Engines. The list should just have one entry, "PyChess.py". The "Command" field should be empty.
3. Click "New" and pick the attached Ildtiadar2 engine (might also work with others)
4. You get a new list entry for Ildtiadar 2. The "Command" field now contains "Ildtiadar2".
!! Please note at this point, no list entry is marked. (this might be a bug already?)
5. Click now the old "PyChess.py" entry to mark it.
Now, the command will remain "Ildtiadar2". This indicates a mix up of settings. (other settings appear to change to PyChess.py-related values though)
