title: PyChess fails on start due to an improper theme name
body:
Original [issue 736](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=736) reported by [liling](https://code.google.com/u/liling/) 2012-11-01

I recently updated the source to the latest (r2290:f642d5c219d4).  The theme I was using, 'cases', was renamed to 'tty-Cases'.  But since my config file (~/.config/pychess/config) still says 'piecetheme = cases', get_svg_pieces() raises some unknown error on start.

The problem can be fixed by manually changing the theme name in the config file.  But to a normal user, this seems unacceptable.

Maybe we should fallback to a default theme if get_svg_pieces() fails to get whatever specified in the config file?

title: PyChess accepts invalid promotion of pawn to king, and is subsequently confused
body:
Original [issue 735](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=735) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-09-26

From UCI engines (probably also CECP), a pawn promotion to a king in a regular chess game is accepted. This is not valid (and PyChess is consequently confused, notating the move as "--" and duplicating the pawn and doing other weird things).

title: PyChess accepts pawn move to last rank without promotion (invalid move)
body:
Original [issue 734](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=734) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-09-22

PyChess accepts pawn moves to the last rank without promotion (invalid move), e.g. it allows to move a white pawn from h7 to h8 as a REGULAR move without promotion suffix. (h7h8 instead of h7h8q, h7h8b, ...)

title: PGN "Date" field can confuse PyChess and lead to errors
body:
Original [issue 731](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=731) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-09-16

When the "Date" field of a PGN file contains unexpected contents, PyChess can end up spitting error messages when attempting to open game properties.

While there should be at some point a fix to support the "YYYY.MM.DD" syntax I suppose, this code change will at least prevent the errors caused by it and possible other unexpected values:

old lib/pychess/widget/gameinfoWidget.py:20+
    widgets["game_info_calendar"].select_month(
            gamemodel.tags["Month"]-1, gamemodel.tags["Year"])
    widgets["game_info_calendar"].select_day(gamemodel.tags["Day"])

new lib/pychess/widget/gameinfoWidget.py:20+
    widgets["game_info_calendar"].select_month(
            int(gamemodel.tags["Month"])-1, int(gamemodel.tags["Year"]))
    widgets["game_info_calendar"].select_day(int(gamemodel.tags["Day"]))

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Go to sound preferences
2. Click the play buttons like mad

After a bit of wild clicking, I get this in the terminal:

(pychess:8806): GStreamer-CRITICAL **: 
Trying to dispose element test, but it is in READY instead of the NULL state.
You need to explicitly set elements to the NULL state before
dropping the final reference, to allow them to clean up.
This problem may also be caused by a refcounting bug in the
application or some element.

Looks like an error that might be worth fixing (if it's in PyChess code and not some upstream library).

hg

title: PyChess crashes or freezes when opening a lot of games with engine players (happens always at new game creation)
body:
Original [issue 720](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=720) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-09-05

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start a lot of concurrent games involving an external engine
2. I used a random mover engine that moved _very_ fast
3. You will get a. drawing errors because the moves are done so fast (that is already quite odd, but not critical) b. a crash/hang because something in PyChess gets messed up. The crash/hang always happens when starting another new game

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
no crash, no hang, user interface will still redraw properly

**Does it happen every time?**
I needed 10-30 concurrent tabs to reproduce it, but eventually it worked everytime I tried (3 times)

**What version of the product are you using?**
hg

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
tried this in hg, but I had the stable staunton 10.1 hang aswell at times so it is probably in there, too

**Please provide any additional information below.**
I attached stdout (terminal output) and the latest game log from the crash and the two hangs

title: 'Engine died' error message picks wrong player name
body:
Original [issue 717](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=717) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-09-04

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start a game playing white, against an engine that will produce only invalid moves playing black
2. Do your first move as white
3. Engine plays followup move as black which is invalid -> gets killed

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Error message is wrong, see attached screenshot

**Does it happen every time?**
tried a few times -> yes, but it needs to be the first game you play after starting pychess

**What version of the product are you using?**
hg code

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
hg/svn

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

title: Pressing left, right should do the same as clicking rewind/forward move buttons
body:
Original [issue 716](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=716) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2012-08-30

Pressing left, right should do the same as clicking the one move back/forward buttons. I think xboard/winboard had this behaviour, and it's pretty neat for easily skipping through a game to get an overview of it.

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start any game
2. Play for a while
3. Press 'left' to go back one move and see how it looked before

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Same happens as if "rewind one move" button in the bottom bar is pressed, but nothing happens.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yup

**What version of the product are you using?**
pychess 0.10.1 (Staunton)

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
Fedora 17

title: Round tag in .pgn files can be string
body:
Original [issue 712](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=712) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2012-07-24

Our parser and game info dialog handles Round as int now, but the spec enables to use x.y.z format. Now we just handle x.

title: gnuchess 6.0.2 as the analyzer always in "Calculating..."
body:
Original [issue 711](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=711) reported by [lingli](https://code.google.com/u/112765254484366593814/) 2012-06-16

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

GNU Chess 5.08 works fine as the analyzer, and the Hints panel gives recommendations from GNU Chess.  With 6.0.2, the Hints panel always shows "Calculating...".  This happens all the time.

**What version of the product are you using?**

PyChess: the latest version (rev feb8886d55f2 of Jun 13, 2012)
GNU Chess: 5.08 and 6.0.2 on Fedora 16/17

**Please provide any additional information below.**

I've attached the gnuchess logs from the "Log Viewer".  It seems to me that both gnuchess 5.08 and 6.0.2 were running fine---both were searching for the best moves with more and more levels.  PyChess is supposed to show the most recent recommendations (with the deepest search level so far), but however, somehow with 6.0.2 that effort fails.

title: create_cairo_font_face_for_file core-dumps
body:
Original [issue 707](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=707) reported by [liling](https://code.google.com/u/liling/) 2012-05-11

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Checkout the hg tip on Fedora 16
2. ./setup.py build
3. Core dumps when creating the theme previews.

The core dump happens at pychess.System.cairoextras.create_cairo_font_face_for_file.  According to the comment in that file, the code was from http://cairographics.org/freetypepython/.  However, it misses a few lines:

diff -r 9dfc2f1cc705 lib/pychess/System/cairoextras.py
--- a/lib/pychess/System/cairoextras.py Sun May 06 20:51:37 2012 +0200
+++ b/lib/pychess/System/cairoextras.py Fri May 11 18:55:37 2012 -0400
@@ -26,6 +26,12 @@
         _freetype_so = ctypes.CDLL ("libfreetype.so.6")
         _cairo_so = ctypes.CDLL ("libcairo.so.2")
-        _cairo_so.cairo_ft_font_face_create_for_ft_face.restype = ctypes.c_void_p
-        _cairo_so.cairo_ft_font_face_create_for_ft_face.argtypes = [ ctypes.c_void_p, ctypes.c_int ]
-        _cairo_so.cairo_set_font_face.argtypes = [ ctypes.c_void_p, ctypes.c_void_p ]
-        _cairo_so.cairo_font_face_status.argtypes = [ ctypes.c_void_p ]
-        _cairo_so.cairo_status.argtypes = [ ctypes.c_void_p ]
  +
       # initialize freetype
       _ft_lib = ctypes.c_void_p ()
       if FT_Err_Ok != _freetype_so.FT_Init_FreeType (ctypes.byref (_ft_lib)):

After putting these lines back, setup.py goes smoothly.

title: loading a game from PGN overwrites player names
body:
Original [issue 679](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=679) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2011-07-02

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load a game from PGN that has the mandatory "White"/"Black" pgn tags
2. Choose a human to play white's side and a computer player to play black's

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
I expect to see the black player's name being displayed on the game's tab rather than, or in addition to, the original player's name. Maybe the game tab should display both player's name, like: "Stockfish 1.8 [original player: Garry Kasparov]". Or at least, we could do that until we have separate modes for viewing PGNs ("Analysis Mode" or whatever), and starting a game from one of the positions in the PGN:

In game viewer mode, one would have the option via "File > Start Game From This Position" to bring up what is currently the "File > Load Game" dialog (albeit without the option to set the variant, which should be determined automatically based on the variant type of the PGN).

1. Log onto fics
2. Before the news and ratings in the right panel have appeared,
3. Press "Show Chat"

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
PyChess freezes, and gnome asks to kill it.

**Did you use PyChess from a repo, tarball, install or hg?**
Tip

**Please use labels and text to provide additional information.**
An (easy?) fix could be to simply freeze the button, till we are ready.

Also concerning the initialization of lounge: Why do you think the news and rating tables loads after the games and players lists? We request them simultaneously, and surely the prior should load faster.

title: KeyError on FICS playing myself
body:

title: Opening perftsuite.epd gives traceback on loadToModel
body:
Original [issue 669](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=669) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2011-05-30

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Open the testing/gamefiles/perftsuite.epd file, so you can choose a game
2. Read the stack trace

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The stack trace gives

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/thomas/Kode/workspace/gbtami-annotation-panel/lib/pychess/widgets/BoardPreview.py", line 123, in on_selection_changed
    self.chessfile.loadToModel(sel, -1, self.gamemodel, False)
TypeError: loadToModel() takes at most 4 arguments (5 given)

It could be that loadToModel had its api updated, but the epd-loader didn't follow on the changes?

It doesn't crash anything, so it's probably just an easy fix on the passed arguments.

**Did you use PyChess from a repo, tarball, install or hg?**

Annotations from hg

title: loading position from finished PGN game always loads game with end result
body:
Original [issue 666](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=666) reported by [ahwaring](https://code.google.com/u/115219200677645090972/) 2011-04-16

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1.Load Game
2.Select engine,variant,and position of interest
3.click Start Game
4.Also Enter game notation causes same thing-copy paste a game then select position and hit Start Game.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
 Expect analysis of human or engine then a move.
 Games ends immediately when Start Game is clicked on.
 Player so and so won. Reason unknown

Does it happen every time? Yes

What version of the product are you using? Staunton 0.10

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
tarball/svn? tarball

**Please provide any additional information below.**
I checked the comments panel for fun and it declares White mates. This is always the case in the comments window.No matter the position or who actually won. My system is 64 bit dual AMD. OS 64 bit Debian Lenny.I have adjusted the enginenest.py and have several 64 bit engines working and a windows 32 bit engine running with wine. Engines work great both normal chess and FischerRandom work without problems so far. I really think pychess is coming along great and use it for play against my engines or over the internet. Thanks for sharing it with us.

your homedirectory, named ".local/share/pychess/"

1. Open pychess_0.10-1_all.deb with Ubuntu Software Centre.

Expected: The package should install PyChess.

"The package is of bad quality"
"The installation of a package which violates the quality standards isn't allowed. This could cause serious problems on your computer. Please contact the person or organisation who provided this package file and include the details beneath."
"Details:

E: pychess: maintainer-address-malformed Pychess team <pychess-people at googlegroups com>

"

Yes.

0.10-1 (Latest)

**tarball/svn?**
.deb

Sorry if I did this bug report wrong. :/

title: Pychess Freezes a couple of seconds after start
body:
Original [issue 664](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=664) reported by [abc.mikey](https://code.google.com/u/115453443829756877204/) 2011-04-04

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. install pychess (tried 0.10-beta1-3ubuntu1 & 0.10-rc1-1)
2. run pychess 
3. it freezes after a few seconds before anything can be done in pychess

Brief background?
I did initially succeed in starting pychess a few times before this problem arose. It initially happened after I removed some (entirely) unrelated packages:

gnome-orca 
thunderbird 
firefox-gnome-support 
firefox 
firefox-branding 
ubufox 
totem-mozilla 
nano 

As informed by 'grep remove /var/log/dpkg.log'

I tried restoring these packages, completely removing pychess and reinstalling, changing the version to 0.10-rc1, reinstalling python, removing directories '.pychess', '.local/share/pychess', '.config/pychess', '.cache/pychess' and '.pychessconf', none of which 
has made any difference.

So perhaps the changes made to my package lists were coincidental.

**Does it happen every time?**

Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**

0.10-rc1

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

Deb package from http://sites.google.com/site/pychess/

**Please provide any additional information below.**

See attached logs

title: PyChess hard-codes /usr/bin/python
body:
Original [issue 661](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=661) reported by [UncombedCoconut](https://code.google.com/u/101407884191342298754/) 2011-03-29

Alexandru Moșoi reported on pychess-people that PyChess won't work on a distribution where "python" defaults to Python 3.x (notably Arch Linux).

His proposed patch is here: https://code.google.com/r/alexandru-pychess/source/detail?r=1f2aaff3de05b08d58aa6e15b0e0f9caba290ed8#

title: PyChess hangs
body:
Original [issue 660](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=660) reported by [alexandru@mosoi.ro](https://code.google.com/u/107884887435318579608/) 2011-03-22

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start the program
2. Press 'Start Game' button

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Start a game.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
Latest from SVN base as of 22 mar 2011.

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

title: Wrong pawn promotion syntax used by PyChess
body:
Original [issue 636](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=636) reported by [jonas.thiem](https://code.google.com/u/jonas.thiem@gmail.com/) 2011-01-10

See http://www.open-aurec.com/wbforum/WinBoard/engine-intf.htmlcomment 8. and scroll down to section "move":

"Pawn promotion:    e7e8q"

PyChess sends a7a8=Q instead (additional, invalid =). For engines that stick exactly to the specs and use SAN=0 (no san notation), this will break the game (e.g. the engine Ildtiadar).

Therefore, please adjust this to the specified syntax for non-SAN engines from the CECP specifications and remove the bogus =.

**What version of the product are you using?**
PyChess 0.10rc1

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
svn

I tried to dig in to the code and find the problem but ran out of steam trying to understand the relevant chess engine code. What I did find was that, at the line crashed at "attackBoard = attack00[cord][ray00[cord] & blocker] | \", attack00 had keys 128-256, but not the key 3L or keys 0-128.

Copyed from:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show\_bug.cgi?id=641553

```
 print >> file, '[Event "%s"]' % model.tags["Event"]

-    print >> file, '[Round "%s"]' % model.tags["Round"]

title: hg head broken (?)
body:
Original [issue 589](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=589) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-09-06

If you do
~/hg/pychess $ hg pull
~/hg/pychess $ hg update
~/hg/pychess $ hg log -l20

You'll see:
...
changeset:   1627:822bbdbe8d42
parent:      1625:d84ae950f540
user:        igor2x igor2x@gmail.com
date:        Fri Sep 03 09:08:06 2010 +0200
summary:     Fixed some slovenian translation specially Tip of the day strings

changeset:   1626:b4bf1ee5b50e
parent:      1615:0b19f2aead68
user:        thomas
date:        Sat Sep 04 21:56:15 2010 +0200
summary:     Fixed translators.py

...

And as I understand Mercurial, any changeset with a different parent than the changeset before it should be followed by a merge, and neither of these revisions were followed by merges. Thomas' revision b4bf1ee5b50e doesn't appear on http://code.google.com/p/pychess/source/list , and that revision b4bf1ee5b50e now appears in "hg heads", and I don't think it should:

gatto@gatto-laptop:~/code/hg/pychess$ hg heads | head -20

tag:         tip

title: {number} Active Seek, Player Ready, Games Running: difficult to translate
body:
Original [issue 581](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=581) reported by [igor2x](https://code.google.com/u/116691631290437288902/) 2010-08-30

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. FICS game
2. Seeks / Challenges tab | {number} Active Seek
or
Player List tab | {number} Player Ready
or
Game List | {number} Games Running

All of this strings is difficult to translate to non-English languages. Why? Because English is very simple just using two forms:
1 Active Seek
2 or more Active Seeks

But any other language specialy Slovenian is extremly complicated like for Active Seek:
1 povpraševanje
2 povpraševanji
3 - 4 povpraševanja
5 - 100 povpraševanj
101 - the same as for 1
102 - the same as for 2
103 - 104 - the same as for 3 - 4
105 - 200 - the same as for 5 - 100
201 - the same as for 1
etc
301 - the same as for 1
etc
etc
etc
each xxx1 has the same as for 1
each xxx2 has the same as for 2
etc

But the things get more comlicated because each naun can have different endings...

So I suggest to make this little more non-English friendly like:
Number of Active Seeks: {number}
Number of Player Ready: {number}
Number of Games Running: {number}

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Non-English languages to have the same level of quality.

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
Latest hg.

title: Some translated strings not shown
body:
Original [issue 569](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=569) reported by [igor2x](https://code.google.com/u/116691631290437288902/) 2010-07-09

After translating all of the strings and running PyChess some strings are still shown in English instead of my language.

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
# I have deleted all hg sources and did the following:
# Download new source

cd ~
mkdir pychess
hg clone https://pychess.googlecode.com/hg/ pychess
cd ~/pychess
hg pull
hg update
./create_template.po.sh
msgmerge ~/pychess/lang/sl/LC_MESSAGES/pychess.po ~/pychess/lang/template.po -o /tmp/new.po
lokalize /tmp/new.po   # Translation program to translate strings
# msgfmt /tmp/new.po -o ~/pychess/lang/sl/LC_MESSAGES/pychess.mo

title: properly migrate old settings
body:
Original [issue 562](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=562) reported by [thomas.spura](https://code.google.com/u/110909423880295359716/) 2010-06-12

There are still quite a lot bugs open in fedora (for a list see:
)

Forwarding now this one:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show\_bug.cgi?id=563687

"""
Updating from pychess-0.8.2-4.fc12.noarch to
pychess-0.10-0.1.20100203svn.fc12.noarch,
results in settings from the older version being merged with settings from the
newer version. That is, the entries in .pychessconf generated by the old
version are, after updating, found in .pychessconf generated by the updated
version.

However, by tedious experiment, I found that the old settings are not generated
by the new version, so they would seem to be unused. While this does not seem
to be a problem, ATM, it is still an unsafe practice that could lead to obscure
bugs.

Putting on my software engineering hat ... :-)

The installer/app. should use a well-defined process for migrating settings
from a configuration file. This could be as simple as renaming the old one and
allowing the app. to create a new one.

The configuration file should have some sort of version info., so it is
possible to tell what version of the app. generated it.  
"""

I couldn't find an other 'settings bug' somewhere, so I needed to open a new issue...

title: UCIEngine analysis mode synchronization problems
body:
Original [issue 551](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=551) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-04-05

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Play a game with stockfish (other UCI engines should theoretically do the same
thing if the moves are played quick enough) as the hint analyzer and make a few
quick moves

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Hints are not shown anymore.

Stockfish seems to be a comparatively reserved chess engine that takes likes
to take a few seconds and think before outputting a 'bestmove' command.
As a result, if a few quick moves are played and stockfish gets sent a
stop-position-go command set, and then another stop-position-go command set
before stockfish can reply with a 'bestmove' reply for the first stop-position-go
command set, then afterwards stockfish will continue to send invalid analysis
lines that apply to the last board rather than the current board.

At the very end of the page at http://wbec-ridderkerk.nl/html/UCIProtocol.html
in the GUI <-> Engine communication example, it says:

// the engine has finished searching and is sending the bestmove command
// which is needed for every "go" command sent to tell the GUI
// that the engine is ready again
        bestmove g1f3 ponder d8f6

The following summary/sampling taken from a PyChess Information Window displaying
a stockfish analysis-mode log shows this happening. A quick exchange Nd4xc6 b7xc6
is done and stockfish gets sent a second stop-position-go before it can reply with a
'bestmove' for the first one. Afterwards, stockfish's analysis gets stuck on
the last board rather than the current one:

title: UCIEngine player crashes due to synchronization problems
body:
Original [issue 550](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=550) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-04-05

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. play some moves against stockfish (although any UCI engine should do the same
thing)
2. undo a bunch of moves really quickly

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
An AssertionError when GameModel.run tries to apply the move to
GameModel.boards[-1], or a PlayerIsDead exception being raised in
GameModel.run when the move doesn't apply to the CECPEngine.board in 
CECPEngine.__parseLine.

This is basically the result of a synchronization problem between UCIEngine and GameModel.

The following sampling/summary of a pychess log file shows what's happening. After
some gameplay it was stockfish's turn to move, and I held down the ctrl-z key for
a few seconds to put enough undos into the undo queue to get pychess to undo back
to the initial game start position. A second or two after I did keystroke(s) to
generate the undos and long before pychess could process all of them, stockfish
asynchronously replied with a 'bestmove' (g4f6) for what it knew the current board
to be, and in UCIEngine.__parseline the move was put into UCIEngine.returnQueue
since it passed validity against UCIEngine.board (which, currently, for a UCI player is not
updated until the player's makeMove() method is called). Then, after pychess finished
processing all the undos, it was my turn to move since I was white, I made a move (f2f4),
GameModel.run asked stockfish for its move, and in UCIEngine.makeMove stockfish
replied with the move already in it's returnQueue, g4f6, which caused an
AssertionError when GameModel tried to apply the move to its current board
(GameModel.boards[1]).

rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/5P2/8/PPPPP1PP/RNBQKBNR b KQkq f3 0 1

We also have to make sure we wait for a 'bestmove' reply for each position-go
command set we send (see issue #551),
or else, if we do an undo when waiting for an engine player's .makeMove() to
return, we risk sending two position-go's in a row with no bestmove in between and screwing
up the engine's state which will lead to an invalid move in UCIEngine.__parseLine
and a PlayerIsDead exception, as shown in attached log file comment 3..

However, it is tricky getting everything to work correctly with all the
different UCI engines. For instance, Fruit and Stockfish respond differently in
the situation where you checkmate them and then do an Undo or Takeback=2. With
Fruit, after it receives the new "stop" "position" "go" commands for the position
after the takeback, it sends a null bestmove (a1a1) reply for the last
"position <checkmated position>"-"go" it was sent in its makeMove() at game end.
Whereas Stockfish in the same situation doesn't send any bestmove. The solution
I've used so far, is to catch the "Unknown command: stop" from stockfish in
UCIEngine.__parseLine and reset stuff and also to do a
stop--then-ignore-bestmove--then-send-new-position iteration after
TurnInterrupt is raised from UCIEngine.undoMoves().

I'm working on a patch, which is attached, but it is a work in progress as it is
tricky to get this right for different engines so I'm still testing it all out.

title: GameModel.run <-> GameModel.undoMoves race condition
body:
Original [issue 549](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=549) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-04-05

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Do a bunch of undos quickly via holding down Ctrl-Z

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
There is a race condition between GameModel.run() and GameModel.undoMoves().

Because GameModel.run() doesn't include emitting "game_changed" and sending the
spectators the new move in the code block that runs with the applyingMoveLock, it
is possible for GameModel.undoMoves() to run in and change something in between
GameModel.run()'s having applied the move with the applyingMoveLock, and emitting
the move update (via self.emit("game_changed")) to listeners like BoardView and the
sidepanels:

This might have been a cause of issue #523 comment 10 and discussed in r1633 r1634 and r1635.
The cause of this can be seen here (copy+pasted from the PyChess Information Window):
## 10:38:35

got moves Qd8 Qe1 Nxf2 Qxf2 from depth 3
CECPEngine.undoMoves: moves=1 board=White k -
q . . . k b . r 
p . . b p p p . 
. . . p . . . p 
. . . . . . . . 
. . . . P . n . 
. . N . . . . . 
P P P . . P P P 
R . B Q . R K . 
force
?
PyChess.__go: move=3643
PyChess.__go: sanmove='Qd8'
move Qd8
CECPEngine.undoMoves: moves=1 board=White kq -
r . . q k b . r 
p . . b p p p . 
. . B p . . . p 
. . . . . . . . 
. . . . P . n . 
. . N . . . . . 
P P P . . P P P 
R . B Q . R K . 
force
?
undo
undo

Notice that CECPEngine.undoMoves() is called again before it has finished the first time.
Forcing the code to get the CECPEngine.changedLock in semisynced() doesn't help
here because the first call to undoMoves() has to wait for the engine to make a
move in _blockTillMove(), and in the process has to give up the changeLock() which
provides an opportunity for the second call to undoMoves() to run through before
the first call finished.

This ends up in the engine being sent its commands in the wrong order and either a hang,
crash, or simply in the engine not responding anymore.

The solution I've come up with which seems to work so far in the last few weeks
that I've been testing it, is mainly to move @inthread decorator out of
CECPEngine.undoMoves() to GameModel.undoMoves() and then queue the calls to
GameModel.undoMoves().

A patch (which I've haven't completely finished doing code cleanup for) is attached.
Please ignore everything in the diff other than changes to @undosync
and the *.undoMoves() which are other fixes/additions and some method and variable
renaming crap that I'm too tired to separate out right now or which need to be cleaned
up (I'm very much looking forward to the move to Mercurial: hooray for cheap local copies
for fixing separate bugs).

title: UCIEngine PlayerIsDead exception after a piece promotion
body:
Original [issue 547](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=547) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-04-05

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load the attached pos.fen and play White against Fruit or Stockfish as Black
2. play f6f7 ... f7f8q
3. wait for engine's reply

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Excerpt, but full log is attached as well:
04:07:11 Default Error: A Player died: player=Fruit 2.1 error=Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gatto/code/svn/pychess-bugfix/lib/pychess/Utils/GameModel.py", line 396, in run
    self.boards[-2])
  File "/home/gatto/code/svn/pychess-bugfix/lib/pychess/Players/UCIEngine.py", line 184, in makeMove
    raise PlayerIsDead
PlayerIsDead

This happens because UCIEngine._startPonder doesn't convert self.pondermove to AN
before sending it in the 'position' command string to the engine:

```
def \_startPonder (self):
    print >> self.engine, "position fen", self.board.asFen(), \
                            "moves", self.pondermove
    print >> self.engine, "go ponder wtime", self.wtime, \
        "btime", self.btime, "winc", self.incr, "binc", self.incr
```

Also, when the move is sent in the 'position ... <pondermove>' string, it has
to match the format of the move string sent from the engine in the
'bestmove ... pondermove ...' string or both stockfish and fruit will either
crash or seems to misinterperet the move and then send an illegal move in reply
causing a PlayerIsDead exception to be raised. The UCI protocol page
http://wbec-ridderkerk.nl/html/UCIProtocol.html says promotions should be in the
"short" AN form:
## Move format:

The move format is in long algebraic notation.
A nullmove from the Engine to the GUI should be send as 0000.
Examples:  e2e4, e7e5, e1g1 (white short castling), e7e8q (for promotion)

The attached patch fixes the problem (but doesn't include the necessary changes to
UCIEngine._startPonder() which are included in the patch of changes attached to the
UCIEngine synchronization problems issue.

title: UCI engines can't castle in chess960 (FRC)
body:
Original [issue 542](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=542) reported by [UncombedCoconut](https://code.google.com/u/101407884191342298754/) 2010-03-09

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Play FRC against Stockfish 1.6.3. (Glaurung will probably work too).
2. Survive long enough for it to decide to castle. :)

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The engine expects to castle. Instead, it's killed.
In UCI the the castling move is sent as "king takes own rook". That is, if 
you start with the standard initial position and white plays O-O, the move 
is sent as e1h1 in FRC even though it would be e1g1 in standard chess.

**Does it happen every time?**
It happened once. Since UCI+castling+chess960 is tricky to get right I just 
assumed you guys don't have it right yet. :)

I have not tested whether the "opposite" bug occurs: if the kings start as 
f1 & f8, white's kingside rook is on h1, and white has kingside castling 
rights... is the move e1g1 treated as O-O when it should be treated as Kg1?

**What version of the product are you using?**
svn r1650

**Please provide any additional information below.**

I doubt the log files will help, but the last communication with Stockfish 
looked like this:
[GUI:]position fen 2q1k2r/4p1pp/2np1p2/1r2b3/2p1PnP1/1bP1N3/3P1P1P/RBQ2KBR 
b h g3 0 16
[GUI:]go wtime 27864 btime 27468 winc 0 binc 0
[Engine:]info depth 1
[Engine:]info depth 1 score cp 731 time 2 nodes 205 nps 102500 pv e8h8
[snip]
[Engine:]info nodes 112121 nps 65606 time 1709 hashfull 2
[Engine:]bestmove e8h8 ponder h2h4
[GUI:]stop
[GUI:]quit

Thanks!

title: load a game ending in mate and undo doesn't work

Original [issue 538](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=538) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-02-28

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. File > Load Game with a game ending in checkmate (such as the one attached).
2. Undo

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Crash no matter what the opposite player engine is.

It would seem that the players and spectators aren't being sent the move history if the game 
loaded ended in mate, thus the crash when you try to undo.

title: NameError: global name 'flag' is not defined
body:
Original [issue 534](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=534) reported by [thomas.spura](https://code.google.com/u/110909423880295359716/) 2010-02-17

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
According to the original submitter:
'''
Well, how to reproduce is hard to say.

I was playing, when I lost I clicked the re-match option. After that the game
begun. But I closed the TAB of the game, then I tried to change the settings of
a new game to play again as white. Then the FEDORA 12 crash icon appeared on
systemtray and the game did not started. So I closed the entire game e
restarted it. It worked, but I thought be better to send the report info. 
'''

But the backtrace showed, that there is no flag, there should be self.flag:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pychess/Players/PyChess.py", line 402,
in process
    def process (worker, messages): print "\n".join(messages)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pychess/System/Log.py", line 19, in
write
    if flag == "stdout":
NameError: global name 'flag' is not defined

The attached patch should fix this.
________________

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show\_bug.cgi?id=565960

title: pychess hangs when moving panel dividers
body:
Original [issue 524](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=524) reported by [thomas.spura](https://code.google.com/u/110909423880295359716/) 2010-02-06

The following is copied from a fedora bug report and modified a bit, to
give some additional infos. I don't have a clue, what's happening there,
maybe you ;)
###### 

Description of problem:
After finishing a game, I was sliding the side panel dividers left and right.
Pychess hung with a horizontal double-arrow pointer. The gnome desktop was also
hung -- could not change workspaces or pull down menus. The pointer moved but
did not change when moved outside the pychess window. The keyboard
(capslock/numlock) was responsive. The consoles could be displayed.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
pychess-0.10-0.1.20100203svn.fc12.noarch
(means r1602)
python-2.6.2-2.fc12.x86_64

How reproducible:
Saw twice.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable display of side panels.
2. Disable display of chat side panel.
3. Play chess -- the second occurrence was after two moves.
4. Move various panel dividers left and right.

Actual results:
Pychess and gnome desktop hang.

Expected results:
Pychess and gnome desktop respond to input.

Additional info:
Recovered by killing all pychess processes from a console.
CPU was at 100%, but I believe that occurs when hint/spy mode are enabled.
Ran strace from a console on all of the pychess processes -- attachment is
on the main bugzilla website:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show\_bug.cgi?id=562471

Direct linkt to the attachment:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=389315

title: Getting "neither player has sufficient material to mate" when there is.

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1.  Play a human vs. human as either white or black OR play a game vs.
PyChess engine as black.
2.  Eat up all the pieces (capture all pieces) until there are only two
kings and the BLACK rook left. (it has to be the BLACK rook)

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

```
 The expected output is a game continuing as normal -- the game should
```

not end, there should be no message.  

**Does it happen every time?**

```
 Yes
```

**What version of the product are you using?**

```
 r1598
```

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

```
  svn
```

**Please provide any additional information below.**

```
I guess you could just replay the .pgns and see the message.  
```

Thanks in advance everyone for your great work!  Please be kind!  Sorry to
be a pest.  

THANK YOU!!!

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".pychess/"

Thanks!!!

Sincerely,
-John

title: Players/PyChess.py crash: line 397, in ondone()
body:
Original [issue 520](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=520) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2010-01-27

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. load the attached pgn in pychess, time control = 5 0, white=human black=PyChess
2. play the following moves (hopefully PyChess.py plays the same moves as black):
kf1 bc4
rxc4 g5
rb8#
3. <ctrl-z> Undo

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gatto/code/svn/pychess-bugfix/lib/pychess/Players/PyChess.py", line 397, in 
ondone
    self.board.applyMove(parseSAN(self.board,result))
  File "/home/gatto/code/svn/pychess-bugfix/lib/pychess/Utils/lutils/lmove.py", line 232, in 
parseSAN
    raise ParsingError, (san, _("the move is an empty string"), board.asFen())
pychess.Utils.lutils.lmove.ParsingError: (None, u'the move is an empty string', 
'1Rk1r2r/2B5/2PB2pp/p3p3/2R5/8/2P2pPP/5K2 b - - 1 36')

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
svn head

This stops the crash:
# Index: lib/pychess/Players/PyChess.py

--- lib/pychess/Players/PyChess.py  (revision 1588)
+++ lib/pychess/Players/PyChess.py  (working copy)
@@ -392,6 +392,9 @@
         def process (worker, messages): print "\n".join(messages)
         self.worker.connect("published", process)
         def ondone (worker, result):
-            if not result:
-                print "warning: worker didn't return a move"
-                return
           self.board.applyMove(parseSAN(self.board,result))
           print "move %s" % result
       self.worker.connect("done", ondone)

title: [PATCH] vanilla package uninstallable under debian
body:
Original [issue 509](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=509) reported by [blauebirke@gmx.de](https://code.google.com/u/110104857474642480294/) 2009-12-11

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**

  with python2.5 (or earlier) installed run:
    $ dpkg-buildpackage
    $ sudo dpkg -i ../pychess_0.8_all.deb

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

  svn: r1560

Patch included:

  Make package installable under debian

```
  * debian/control: "XS-Python-Version: >= 2.5" as with\_statement needed
  * sidepanel/historyPanel.py: "import \_\_future\_\_" to support python 2.5
```

Unrelated Note:

  beta version should have used '~' instead of '-':
     0.8-beta4 >> 0.8 >> 0.8~beta4

title: Double-click on member from Challenges panel starts the game with the user I haven't chose
body:
Original [issue 501](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=501) reported by [igor2x](https://code.google.com/u/116691631290437288902/) 2009-11-02

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. FICS game
2. Seek / Challenges tab
3. I click on member, but instead of getting the member I have selected I
get another player with different name/rating.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
I should get the user I have selected or get an error if that user can't be
selected anymore.

**Does it happen every time?**
No.

**What version of the product are you using?**
Latest svn.

**Please provide any additional information below.**
Some time when I double click this happens on player to select him/her to
play with:
Inside double click event (less then a second) after first click is done
and member is selected, that member disappear from the list, most probably
some other member has selected the player, and then when second click is
done, some other player is on the cursor position where the cursor was when
first click was executed. But what happens? A new player that was on the
position of current row cursor get selected and played by me.

This should not happen, in reality I have selected first player by clicking
on them, but on second click this player is not available anymore, so
second click should only select another player but not start playing with him.

title: Chess board gets automatically rotated when loading a game
body:
Original [issue 487](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=487) reported by [igor2x](https://code.google.com/u/116691631290437288902/) 2009-08-08

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Save a finished game played in FICS to disk pgn file.
2. Pychess menu Game | Load game and open pgn file
3. "Open Game" window appears (see attachment pychess1.png)
4. You see I am white, my opponent is black. I press "Start Game" button
5. Game correctly opens (see attachment pychess2.png)
6. But one second later board is automatically rotated (see attachemnt
pychess3.png). Why?

I can solve the problem by executing View | Rotate Board, but it is just
waste of time.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Chess board should not be automatically rotated if I am white player.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
svn 1510 (not the latest svn version at the moment)

**Please provide any additional information below.**
Some times I like to analyze game that I have played by some FICS user. So
I save a game and then open it to review the game. When opening a pgn file
board gets automatically rotated. Don't know why this happen. I was a white
player when game was saved, so why board is rotated. Is this a bug?

title: no accepted move with loosers if in check and can take a piece
body:
Original [issue 486](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=486) reported by [blauebirke@gmx.de](https://code.google.com/u/110104857474642480294/) 2009-08-06

Playing variant loosers, pychess doesn't accept any move if he is in check
and can take a piece (which doesn't solve the check). E.g.:
1. d4   c5
2. dxc5 Qa5+

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

If no legal move can take a piece than the player isn't forced to take a
piece. In the example Qd2 is legal. Instead no move was excepted (tried all
disregarding being in check), but the game didn't end (no patt or so).

**Does it happen every time?**

Yes.

**What version of the product are you using?**

trunk r1512.

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**

Built deb-package via "dpkb-buildpackage -b" from svn.

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile. It's in a hidden folder, under**
your homedirectory, named ".pychess/"

Done.

title: deadlock upon clicking "Undo 2 moves" button at game end
body:
Original [issue 484](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=484) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2009-07-25

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. play a game against a computer opponent and win

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Instead of an undo, pychess freezez due to a deadlock.

This change fixes it, although I'm not yet sure it's the best way to fix it:
# Index: lib/pychess/Players/CECPEngine.py

--- lib/pychess/Players/CECPEngine.py   (revision 1509)
+++ lib/pychess/Players/CECPEngine.py   (working copy)
@@ -449,7 +450,7 @@
                 self.returnQueue.put("int")

```
         self.\_\_force()
```
-            if self.board:
-            if self.board and gamemodel.status in UNFINISHED_STATES:
               self.__hurry()
               self._blockTillMove()

title: moving a piece doesn't work when it's been selected
body:
Original [issue 483](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=483) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2009-07-25

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. click a piece to select it
2. click the piece again (without releasing the mouse) and drag it to
another square to make a legal move

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
It should move the piece, but instead, it's sent back to its source square.

The fix is pretty easy and will be a part of a patch to implement
"pre-drag" or "manual pre-move" support from issue #300.

title: Protover problem when pychess got timeout error
body:
Original [issue 465](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=465) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2009-06-05

Sometimes when I start pychess, then go with a quick game against pychess
engine, the engine gets timeout error, and treating itself as protover 1.
Then it cumulates into en AttributeError exception.

title: Fingering players with titles doesn't work
body:
Original [issue 455](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=455) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2009-05-07

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Finger somebody with a title, such as a (*), either by clicking the
"Private Chat" button in the Player List, or by clicking the "player +"
button in the Chat Window

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Instead of the players finger notes you get a "Loading player data..." message.

This is because the regex in FingerManager doesn't match finger command
output when their is titles after the player's name.

title: problems with untimed games on FICS
body:
Original [issue 448](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=448) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2009-04-23

untimed games on FICS don't work. There's two problems:

FIRST PROBLEM
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the FICS Lounge in pychess and receive a match offer for an untimed
game

Result:
  File
"/home/gatto/code/svn/pychess-bugfix/lib/pychess/ic/managers/OfferManager.py",
line 124, in onOfferAdd
    matchre.match(parameters).groups()
<type 'exceptions.AttributeError'> 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'groups'

SECOND PROBLEM
When you start an untimed game the clocks appear and start at 0 and count
down into negative seconds. They shouldn't appear in untimed games, just
like when you start an untimed game from the New Game Dialog. This is fixed
simply by detecting 0 min and 0 inc and setting timemodel = None.

title: FICS bugs
body:
Original [issue 444](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=444) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2009-04-12

I'm too lazy to separate these and the patches, so here's a few FICS issues:

ISSUE 1
**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Log into FICS, start a game, play 4 moves and abort the game

Result:
After another game with the same gameno as the aborted game finishes, the
yellow Game Result label changes from "Aborted" to the game result of the
next FICS game with the same gameno when it finishes. Also, any sounds from
that game will be mysteriously played in the background.

This is because FICS reuses gamenumbers when games finish and the GameModel
thinks any signal with the same gameno is it's own game. The fix is to
filter games based on a combination of gameno AND player names.

ISSUE 2
**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Log into FICS, and observe a game
2. Start a new game and play 4 moves. In the new game, recieve an Abort offer.

Result:
The game is automatically aborted and both an "Abort Offer" window and an
"Offer Withdrawn" window appear.

This is because ICPlayers in the observed game recieve the offer and
incorrectly pass it on to their GameModel which calls opPlayer.offer(offer)
on the other ICPlayer. And ICPlayer.offer() is actually the FICS offer
command, so the other ICPlayer ends up sending the server an abort
counter-offer which the server interprets as an acceptance of the original
abort offer and the game is aborted. This is fixed by making sure ICPlayers
in observed games filter out offer signals.

ISSUE 3
**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Log into FICS, and observe a game
2. Start a new game

Result:
In the observed game, the time keeps running on the player who's turn it is
to move, but no further board updates or game clock changes are relayed
other then the game result when it finishes. This is because, by default,
when you start a game in FICS any observed games are removed from
observation. This is fixed simply by setting the 'unobserve' variable to 3.

title: Pychess svn build crashes on start at the engine search
body:
Original [issue 424](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=424) reported by [maxmusterm](https://code.google.com/u/114206061950813382165/) 2009-03-22

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
**1.**
install gnuchess and another engine (I say gnuchess because it only happens
with gnuchess on my pc)
**2.**
get the newest subversion build
**3.**
try to start pychess

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The expected output is nothing but I see

22:46:52 (u'Gnuchess', '22:03:52.379') Error: Success
22:46:53 (u'Crafty', '22:03:52.933') Error: Permission denied

/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/System/SubProcess.py:82: Warning:
Invalid file descriptor.

  channel.close()
  File "./pychess", line 40, in <module>
    import pychess.Main
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/Main.py", line 17, in
<module>
    from pychess.widgets import tipOfTheDay
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/widgets/tipOfTheDay.py",
line 7, in <module>
    uistuff.cacheGladefile("tipoftheday.glade")
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/System/uistuff.py", line
353, in cacheGladefile
    pool.start(readit)
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/Players/engineNest.py",
line 344, in run
    rechecks = self._findOutMore(toBeDiscovered)
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/Players/engineNest.py",
line 269, in _findOutMore
    engine.start()
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/Players/CECPEngine.py",
line 145, in start
    self.__startBlocking()
  File "/home/blacklotus/work/pychess/lib/pychess/Players/CECPEngine.py",
line 158, in __startBlocking
    assert r == "ready"
<type 'exceptions.AssertionError'> 

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes it does.

**Please provide any additional information below.**
A workaround is to uninstall gnuchess, start pychess, close pychess,install
gnuchess and then start pychess again.
The cause of the error is that pychess is "to fast" and it doesn't find the
childprocess of gnuchess in time to close the channels. (i know i'm
horrible at explaining)
The easiest code fix (I found in the few minutes i looked over the code
there sure is a better fix) would be a sleep in SubProcess.py in line 80 like:

```
    time.sleep(0.1)
    for channel in (self.inChannel, self.outChannel, self.errChannel):
```

That fixed it for me.

3. I have merged po files: old translation and new translation
4. I have translated all (100%) of strings to my language
5. I have created mo file
6. Copied mo file to language location path
7. Start PyChess and there are some strings that are not translated and as
I see not included in generated translation po file.
a) Settings | Preferences | "Sidepanels" tab is not translated
b) Settings | Preferences | Sidepanels tab | Disable button is not translated
c) Connect to FICS | "Adjourned" tab is not translated
d) Connect to FICS | "Adjourned" tab | all of the buttons (Preview, Abort,
Draw, Resign, Resume) are not translated
e) Connect to FICS | "Adjourned" tab | Is online | "False" & "True" are not
translated.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Instead of Slovenian translation I see English words. I have searched po
files for above strings and this strings are missing.

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
development version from source subversion system

**Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a**
**tarball/svn?**
svn

SVN

python) please let me know!!!

THANKS!!!

Sincerely,
John Zollo

title: Fischer castling can be invisible in simple notation. Breaks engines
body:
Original [issue 362](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=362) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2008-12-28

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**

Play this game: g1f3, e7e6, d2d4, d7d5, c1g5, f8d6, f3e5, g8h6, g5h6, d6f8,
h6f4, f7f5, f1g1, d8f6, e5f3, c8d7, f4g5, b8c8

The last move was actually a castlemove, but the engines (understandably)
interprets it as a king move, and thus don't move the rook (a8->d8)

title: PyChess gets stuck in a position
body:
Original [issue 361](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=361) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2008-12-20

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start PyChess in text-mode 'PYTHONPATH=lib/ python
lib/pychess/Players/PyChess.py'
2. 'setboard r4k2/2p1q2p/P1p3p1/2Pn1p1P/2B1pR2/1p6/5Q2/3N3K w - - 1 45'
3. 'analyze'

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

PyChess gets stuck after searching ply 4. This is the same with PyChess in
play mode, where time-management should have taken care. So either we got
stuck in some loop, or in quientscent search. It can't be a deadlock, as
PyChess uses 100% cpu. It is probably not quientscent either, as I've had
it search for hours with no sign of progression.

Output is:
1   21.0    0.04    64  Bxd5 cxd5
32.0 moves/position; 1463.0 n/s
2   21.0    0.12    248     Bxd5 cxd5
6.4 moves/position; 3412.6 n/s
3   -171.0  0.71    2871    Qb2 Rxa6 Qh8+ Kf7
8.5 moves/position; 4805.6 n/s
4   -56.0   2.27    8074    Bxd5 cxd5 hxg6 Rxa6
6.0 moves/position; 5168.9 n/s

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?

Trunk

title: infinite loop in SpotGraph.py
body:
Original [issue 359](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=359) reported by [mattgatto](https://code.google.com/u/mattgatto/) 2008-12-18

I am having a sort of reproducible problem where I start pychess and
connect to FICS and upon login and the ICLounge.py window being
initialized, pychess freezes in SpotGraph.py.

This is because, sometimes, in SpotGraph.py, self.get_allocation() returns
a GdkRectangle with x and y == -1, apparently because the rectangle is not
allocated yet (my guess but I have no idea) and SpotGraph is trying to add
new Spots to it and not expecting the GdkRectangle that
self.get_allocation() returns to have negative values. So what happens is
that SpotGraph.prcToPix returns x and y values that are negative to
SpotGraph.isEmpty which interprets them as out of bounds values and returns
False to SpotGraph.getNearestFreeNeighbourHexigon which ends up in an
infinite loop because it can't find a valid place to put the Spot.

title: Need a way to use another port than 5000
body:
Original [issue 353](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=353) reported by [asathoor](https://code.google.com/u/109995774260759656467/) 2008-10-23

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Open pychess try to connect to fics
**2.**
**3.**

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

I cannot log into fics

**Does it happen every time?**

yes

**What version of the product are you using?**

0.82

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?

from ubuntu repositories

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile.**
For PyChess <= 0.6.x it's hidden in your homedirectory and called
".pychess.log".
For PyChess > 0.6.x, it's in a hidden folder, under your homedirectory,
named ".pychess/"

title: "Offer undo" bug
body:
Original [issue 350](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=350) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2008-09-30

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start a quick game against PyChess
2. Take 2 move avoiding tha book
3. Befor PyChess 2. move chose "Offer undo" from actions menu

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The program is frozen

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
svn 1169

title: PyChess gets unstable after a game has been closed
body:
Original [issue 347](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=347) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2008-09-20

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start a game
2. Close it on the X
3. Aggressively press some UI component, like a menuitem.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Half of the time PyChess crashes with something like
"08294e73-c174-0861-392610b8-223251f7 is dumped"
The other half it just spits a lot of strange warnings out:
"Main.py:228: Warning: instance of invalid non-instantiatable type
`(null)'" or "python: xcb_io.c:120: process_responses: Assertion
(assertion) '!(req && current_request && !((int) ((req->sequence) -
(current_request)) <= 0))' failed."

While no games has been closed yet (none started or just still running)
everything is as stable as a rock.

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
Trunk

title: white pieces should be white even over black squares
body:
Original [issue 341](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=341) reported by [missive@hotmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/112846409828153670364/) 2008-09-14

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start game
2. White pieces are different colors over different color squares

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
White pieces should always be the same color, no matter which
color square they are on (like the black pieces are)

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
0.8.1

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
Installed on Ubuntu 8.04

**Please provide any additional information below.**

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile.**
For PyChess <= 0.6.x it's hidden in your homedirectory and called
".pychess.log".
For PyChess > 0.6.x, it's in a hidden folder, under your homedirectory,
named ".pychess/"

title: gobject not imported
body:
Original [issue 340](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=340) reported by [michel.sylvan](https://code.google.com/u/106783242436572907187/) 2008-08-27

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Run pychess

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Should work. Instead, a crash because in newGameDialog.py, an exception
defined in gobject is caught without gobject being imported

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
Installed

title: Some icons not provided by gnome-icon-theme
body:
Original [issue 339](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=339) reported by [michel.sylvan](https://code.google.com/u/106783242436572907187/) 2008-08-27

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Run pychess without echo-icon-theme (or any other icon theme that
provides icons modified in patch below)

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
Should work; pychess claims dependency only on gnome-icon-theme

Note: In some places, pychess is already using an alternate icon set if the
stock_\* icons are not found; this just needs to be extended to cover the
places addressed in the patch.

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
Installed

title: 1/2-1/2 in move 1.
body:
Original [issue 327](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=327) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2008-06-01

title: Disambiguation in ACN notation
body:
Original [issue 323](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=323) reported by [voinescu.andrei](https://code.google.com/u/110802094834163447459/) 2008-04-29

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start pyChess in Player vs. Player mode
2. Promote pawns until a total of 4 queens. Place queens in 3x3 square
3. Move a queen in center

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

for 3x3 square (3->5) x (f->h) it should be something like
Qf3g4 or Qh3g4, instead i see Q3g4 for both moves.
There has to be some disambiguation on both ranks and files notation:
(from Wikipedia)
"Disambiguating moves

If two (or more) identical pieces can move to the same square, the piece's
initial is followed by (in descending order of preference):
1. the file of departure if they differ;
2. the rank of departure if the files are the same but the ranks differ;
3. Both the rank and file if neither alone uniquely defines the piece
   (after a pawn promotion, if three or more of the same piece are able to
   reach the square).

For example, with two knights on g1 and d2, either of which might move to
f3, the move is indicated as Ngf3 or Ndf3, as appropriate. With two knights
on g5 and g1, the moves are N5f3 or N1f3. As above, an x may be used to
indicate a capture: for example, N5xf3."

**Does it happen every time?**
Yes

**What version of the product are you using?**
-c Grecco 0.6.1

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
intalled via apt-get

**Please provide any additional information below.**
not necessary

**Please attach the latest pychess logfile.**
For PyChess <= 0.6.x it's hidden in your homedirectory and called
".pychess.log".
For PyChess > 0.6.x, it's in a hidden folder, under your homedirectory,
named ".pychess/"

title: CECP crash on pgn'ed undo
body:
Original [issue 295](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=295) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2008-01-14

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Load a 2+ moves pgn
2. Offer undo

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
As the engine knows no moves before the latest in the pgn, it can't undo.
To solve this, cecp engines should have the moves forced rather than
"setboard"'ed. At least for pgns. This will also let engines like Faile
load games.

title: Quiescent doesn't find fork.
body:
Original [issue 278](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=278) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2007-12-30

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Loading the attached game in revision 811 (current trunk)
2. Let PyChess beta3 have white
3. Don't give it too much time

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
PyChess plays O-O-O and quickly suffers from Nxf2 - a fork on the rooks

**Please use labels and text to provide additional information.**
In the log we see, that PyChess guesses black to respond with Qf2 - "moves
were: O-O-O Qxf2 98"
If PyChess get a lot of time, it plays the same as other engines, Rb1 or Bc1.

I've tried to change "searching = False" to "depth = 0" in search.py in

timecheck_counter -= 1
if timecheck_counter == 0:
    if time() > endtime:
        searching = False
    timecheck_counter = TIMECHECK_FREQ

to ensure quiescent search is activated. However it doesn't seem to make a
change. Only by adding more time - and thereby letting PyChess do another
alphabeta - a reasonable move is found.

Original [issue 229](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=229) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2007-10-03

It sometimes happen when you close PyChess, that a background thread hasn't
finished, and thus leaves PyChess hanging.
This can be avoided by setting setDaemon(True) on the Threads and
Threadsubclasses.
Even more ideal would it be to make a class with Thread api, which uses
ThreadPool internally. ThreadPool which always sets daemon.

title: Asynchronous gdk in lounge
body:
Original [issue 202](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=202) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2007-09-09

I sometimes experience xlib errors when logging into fics using pychess.
This happens more often on multicore processors, and is generally an
indication of gdk usage in a non main string.
The problem is less to find out what went wrong and how to fix it (put
gdk_lock around the ui code), but merely to point out which lines are being
called asynchronous.

Error looks like this:

The program '-c' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadLength (poly request too large or internal Xlib length erro'.
  (Details: serial 24842 error_code 16 request_code 56 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)

title: All lock uses should be in try...finally
body:
Original [issue 191](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=191) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2007-08-16

The lock.acquire calls and the code in between should be in a try block.
The lock.release calls should be in finally.

This way the lock will be released if the code in between crashes.

3. Pick White human Black a engine and start the game
4. Go to menu and click on "Game | Quit" and "Revert"

The program freezes only when i use the quit option. Using the "close
button" of window manager it closes normally

**What version of the product are you using?**
0.6.0_beta5

Did you use an installed version of PyChess or did you run in from a
tarball/svn?
i install from the ubuntu repositories

Kubuntu 7.04
2.6.20-16-generic comment 2. SMP i686 GNU/Linux

title: Figure notation has problems

a + on check.

title: Close Dialog: Small Changes
body:
Original [issue 173](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=173) reported by [tonyr1988](https://code.google.com/u/114312835121027486076/) 2007-05-10

Anytime that you close a tab, there's a window that reads:

"Save the current game before you close it?

It is not possible later to continue the game, if do don't save it.

Revert - Cancel - Save"

Two minor complaints:

1) The grammar problem in the second part. "if do don't save it" needs to
be re-worded.

2) I think the Revert key could be non-intuitive. Perhaps something like
"Discard" or "Do Not Save"? Or perhaps re-wording it so that it asks
something like "Would you like to save the game? Yes - No - Cancel"

title: Spelling error in setup.py

In LONG_DESC, the word beautyful should be corrected to beautiful.

Also, it would make more sense to drop the phrase "a the same time" from
LONG_DESC as well.

Therefore, the line should look like this.

LONG_DESC = """PyChess is a gtk chessgame for Linux. It is designed to be
easy to use, beautiful to look at and provide advanced functions for
advanced players"""

title: PyChess (0.7) does not mate
body:
Original [issue 152](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=152) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2007-02-19

When PyChess foresees a mate something strange happens: It doesn't mate.
When I look in its output, I see the following:

moves were: Qf2 Kb1 g1=Q#
move Qf2
usermove a1b1
moves were: f3 Ka1 g1=Q#
move f3
usermove b1a1
moves were: Rac8 Kb1 g1=Q#
move Rac8
usermove a1b1
moves were: a4 Ka1 g1=Q#
move a4
usermove b1a1
moves were: a3 Kb1 g1=Q#
move a3

which leads me to the conclusion that pychess is fine mating, but doesn't
mind doing some other stuff before that. "I can always win" it thinks.

Can we somehow make PyChess prefer easy wins?

**Please use labels and text to provide additional information.**

Instead of locking the entire view menu, we should only lock the nessesery
entries (all besides lock viewer) or perhaps we should move it to another
menu, but I can't imagine any one more obvious.

title: Dialog when quitting with unsaved games :
body:
Original [issue 143](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=143) reported by [pierre.boulenguez](https://code.google.com/u/106835073645383871058/) 2007-01-16

Quitting pychess with unsaved game(s), result in a widget prompting :
- There are %d games with unsaved changes
  (ok)   (cancel) 

1) It would be nice to have two cases :
   There is a game with unsaved changes
or
   There are %d games with unsaved changes

2) The text of the buttons are automatically translated and the meaning is
fuzzy (something like 'restore' for the ok button).

I am unable to translate this correctly in the .po because of the
automaticaliness ( is this english :) of the translation.

title: test pychess against another, but modified one
body:
Original [issue 142](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=142) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2007-01-13

If somehow you can run pychess engine against a modified one (f.e. with a
changed search method in svn head), you can test if with that modification
you can get faster/better result.

title: quiescent search patch
body:
Original [issue 141](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=141) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2007-01-13

The quiescent searc is not working in current code.
If alphaBeta was called f.e. with depth=3, and no captures was on leafs, it
doesn't visit if there is any captures in the next ply.
The attached patch decouples the quiescent search, and i hope works more
better.

title: why eval is not symmetric?
body:
Original [issue 140](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=140) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2007-01-11

pychess's eval with start board produces +5, instead of 0.
Is this on purpose?

title: testing pychess's move generation
body:
Original [issue 139](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=139) reported by [gbtami](https://code.google.com/u/gbtami/) 2007-01-11

issue #134 showed that pychess's move generation needs some testing.
I find a testsuite here: http://mypage.bluewin.ch/romanhartmann/perft.html
Wrote a little script to use it, and voila, the second game in
perftsuite.epd running with depth 3 failed. I got 97898 instead of 97862.

title: Add real epd support
body:
Original [issue 124](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=124) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-12-26

The current epdsaver actually saves in fen format. The epd format contains
extra information, e.g. for threefold testing.
http://chess.verhelst.org/1994/03/12/epd/#more-26

It would also be good to have a fen function the the Utils packet, to avoid
the StringIO hack. Perhaps the epd saver can use the function, and only add
a few more informations.

title: Piece position isn't reset when canceling promotion
body:
Original [issue 119](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=119) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-12-23

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. _Drag_ a pawn to the last row
2. When that promotion dialog appears, click the X

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
The piece isn't set back, but stays "in the air"

**Please use labels and text to provide additional information.**
BoardControl should call "runAnimtion" when a promotion has been cancelled.

title: Clear arrows when game is finished
body:
Original [issue 111](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=111) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-12-21

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Start/Load a game
2. Let hint-/spymode analyzer be crafty (or sjeng I think)
2. Turn hint and spy mode on
3. Play the game to the end

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**

A last buggy arrow appears. Probably because the engine starts analyzing a
new clear game.

Arrows should be disconnected when game is finished.

title: Saving a file, loaded from a multiple games file, causes all games to be overwritten
body:
Original [issue 92](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=92) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-11-27

As descriped in the title: When you choose to open game 4 from a pgn of 8
files. Make a couple of moves, and then press the "Save" item.
- Should pychess open the "save as" dialog, to save it in a new file?
- Should pychess change the 4th. game in the file?
- Should pychess warn the user, and if wanted, overwrite the file?

Also when trying to save a game in a file with the same name as another
e.g. pgn file, should pychess ask "Overwrite", "Cancel" and "Add", or
simply "Overwrite" and "Cancel".

An overwrite nth. game in file chould also be added...

Personally I think we should try to keep it simple, and avoid to much
multiple games in file stuff, but on the other hand, things should be
consistent...

title: Multiple open games
body:
Original [issue 80](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=80) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-11-05

Many chessclients (Knights and glchess) have tabs for playing multiple
games at once.

I find it a good idea, but I'm not sure how best to implement it in PyChess.
The main questions is: Should the sidepanel be inside or outside the
notebook? And what about the clock?

In a later version, I'd like to see PyChess having a dynamic interface like
many IDEs, enabling users to view multiple sidepanels at once.

title: Engine processes aren't daemons
body:
Original [issue 47](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=47) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-09-21

If Pychess crashes, or is killed, the engines continue to run.
For threading.Thread's this could be prevented by having the subthreads
being daemonthreads, that only can exist when the mainthread is running. I
just don't see any way to do the same for Popen's?

ConfigParser module instead. That would make pychess more attractive to
non-GNOME users.

title: Split Board in Viewer and Controller
body:
Original [issue 43](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=43) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-09-15

The CairoBoard class will need to be splitted into two classes:
One extending gtk.DrawingArea, and one extending gtk.EventBox.
The main board should hold both (first one in the second), but other where,
e.g. the analyze sidepanel, might only need the first one.

title: Unnecessary files in Subversion repository

You may want to mark these files as ignored using 'svn propedit svn:ignore
.' in each directory.

title: Issues running SVN version Sept 8 2006
body:
Original [issue 38](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=38) reported by [robert.ancell](https://code.google.com/u/106527694663794732344/) 2006-09-08

I checked out the source and tried it. Works after the following changes:

o Remove 'ICS' from __init__.py in Players/ (missing file?).
o If an engine is not installed then:
- Player.name must be '' not None.
- self.inn.readline() will return '', return from method to avoid
  infinite loop.

There is no contact information for this project in source or webpage, for
more information contact me at bob27@users.sourceforge.net. I have a
similar PyGTK project (glchess.sourceforge.net) - I would be interested in
making these two projects as compatible as possible (i.e. save games and
LAN networking).

Cheers,
--Robert

title: milisecond support in chessclock
body:
Original [issue 22](https://code.google.com/p/pychess/issues/detail?id=22) reported by [lobais](https://code.google.com/u/lobais/) 2006-08-31

Could be made by saving a timestamp every one second..
Could also be made by updating very often, but not always calling repaint.
Should probably be both.
